title: Leave Replacement Learning Specialist, Grades 5-8
description:
Trinity School, a co-educational, K-12 institution located on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, seeks a Leave Replacement Learning Specialist to serve students in grades 5-8, from October 28 - December 2, 2024.
  
  

Middle School learning specialists provide academic services in the form of individual, small, and large group academic coaching. The role places an emphasis on bringing together research and best teaching practices to remediate specific skills of our students across educational settings, which include language arts, math, social studies, and science. Learning specialists collaborate with faculty to help increase our teachers' awareness and understanding of students' learning needs and to offer suggestions for differentiating classroom instruction for students with different learning styles or specific learning challenges.
  
  

Responsibilities will include a full-time teaching load of four sections, advising a group of 8-10 students, and attending grade-level and faculty meetings.
  
  

The successful candidate will be a dedicated, skilled learning specialist with a Master's degree in Special Education, Learning Disabilities, School Psychology, or related field of study, have demonstrated successful teaching experience, and be able to work effectively with Middle School students, families, and faculty. In addition, the School seeks candidates who possess intellectual curiosity, a commitment to ongoing professional development, an openness to others' ideas, an eagerness to extend oneself for others, and a sense of humor.
  
  

**Responsibilities as Middle School Learning Specialist include:**
  
  

* Serve as an integral member of the Learning Support Team under the supervision of the Learning Support Department Head and the Middle School Principal.
* Meet routinely with the Learning Support Department Head and other learning specialists within the division and across divisions to share information about students, to set goals for the division and department, and to engage in professional development.
* Provide reading support and teach specific writing strategies to students.
* Provide resources, strategies, and teaching techniques to teachers to support students with varying learning needs.
* Develop, implement, and monitor a school-based learning plan with a profile that includes instructional learning goals and accommodations for eligible students.
* Support the coordination of school-based assessments for students eligible for accommodations.


An Equal Opportunity Employer, Trinity School seeks candidates who will add to the diversity of its school community. More than this, Trinity is expressly committed to becoming an anti-racist institution and is calling on all members of its community to join in this important work.
  
  

Interested candidates should post a resume as well as a cover letter outlining their readiness for this position. Applications that do not include a cover letter will not be considered.
  
  

**Salary range:** $69,200 - $165,700 (salary based upon experience, pro-rated for 5 weeks)

title: Real Estate Coach
description:
Primary Objectives – What are the major objectives or outcomes to be accomplished by the

person in this job?

\\* Support the goals of the Program by moving non-capping associates in to capping status

through skill set training, mindset development, and business coaching.

 Provide Foundational training, support and coaching for associates to achieve the

standard of 25% (or a minimum of 10) of associates in the Program obtain capper status

within their first year.

 Provide Foundational training, support and coaching for associates to achieve the

standard of 50% or more of those in the Program are productive every month.

 Promote and provide opportunities to maintain a minimum of 80% Engagement in the

Program per month.

\\*Support the standards of the Program by recruiting a minimum of 5 agents to the program

monthly. (Holding recruiting appointments or co-hosting career nights monthly as determined

by the Market Center Team Leader may also be an additional standard.)

2. Regular Work Activities – What are the most frequent and most essential work activities in

this job?

\\* Conduct weekly skill set training on SCRIPTS and Lead Generation – DAILY from 8:30 –

11:00am (or as otherwise agreed upon with Lead Productivity Coach)

\\*Use the concepts in, support and teach (as needed) the CORE training curriculum from KWRI …

primarily IGNITE, 36-12-3, Win the Seller & Win the Buyer, Never Ending Referrals, BOLD, i.e.,

Script Books, presentations, for both full-time and dual-career agents.

\\*Be available during designated hours to Coaching Clients to assist them through the real estate

process. Following are, not limited to, specific examples:

\\* Practicing scripts for lead generation

\\* Utilizing Pre-Listing and Buyer Lead sheet

\\* Role Playing Listing and Buyer consultations and objections from appointments

\\* Preparing Listing and Buyer Consultation packets including CMA and Contract

documents

\\* Assisting them with Marketing Campaigns for a minimum of 500 people

\\* Assisting them with using the Mentors/mykw tools/COMMAND for database, pipeline,

task, calendars, contracts, etc.

PC PC LAUNCH Coach - Job Standards Agreement 2020 rev 04/15/2020 2 | Page

\\* Answering general questions on the Coaching Club Facebook group and via

phone/email/text.

\\* Be available (as needed) to either have an engaged agent Shadow on one of your

appointments OR attend an appointment with agent as support.

\\* Ensure goals are set in Command and GPS/4-1-1 are complete for all in the program.

\\* Reach out to those not producing on a weekly basis as discussed with Lead Productivity

Coach/ Director of Career Development.

\\* Lead the weekly Group Skill Set Coaching sessions and host quarterly REALskill Workshops

focused on Listing & Buyer Consultations and Pricing in this Market.

\\*Hold a minimum of 10 appointments a month to talk with agents about joining the PC

program.

\\* Work with Director of Ops to ensure reporting is completed daily, weekly and monthly.

\\* Participate in weekly call or meeting with Director of Productivity Coaching to identify

potential candidates, identify those that may be in jeopardy of leaving real estate,

create individual growth plans to improve skills for clients, and review the progress of

those in the program.

\\* Participate in weekly KW Coaching call for Productivity Coaches.

\\* Support the Goals and Initiatives of the Market Center.

3. Responsibilities – How many people will be directly overseen by this person?

\\* Approximately 30-50 associates

\\* Specifically, those that have not CAPPED or those who do not have a pipeline that shows they

will be a capping agent. A minimum standard is that each agent will have CLOSED at least 1

Listing AND a minimum of 2 Buyer transactions (level 1) within a 6-month time frame.

4. Key Skills – What behavioral traits, attitudes, and skills are required?

\\* Mastery of the KW core agent curriculum: Ignite, Lead Generation 36; 12;3, Contract

training, title and inspection process, COMMAND marketing and database, Dot Loop etc.

\\* Record of sales success selling a minimum of 12 transactions in one year as a Licensed Real

Estate Agent

\\* Has participated in BOLD and understands basic concepts of the material

\\* Superior time management skills and utilize 4-1-1 and daily calendar

\\* Ability to balance ‘care and candor’ during accountability sessions

\\* Passionate about training and educating

\\* Learning-based attitude

\\* Respected leader in the Market Center with high integrity

\\* Exhibits a supportive, results-oriented approach to situations and goals

\\* Coachable and willing to participate in Coaching as identified by Lead Productivity Coach

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $250,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Choose your own hours

Ability to Relocate:

* Manhasset, NY 11030: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Customer Service Representative Fueler/Washer
description:
Location: 48 3rd Street, South Kearny, NJ. 07032


**What’s the Job?**


Ready to accelerate your career while helping our customers move forward? As a Customer Service Representative Fueler/Washer at Penske, you’ll do exactly that. You will make sure vehicles are fueled, clean and safe before they hit the road again. You will be the face of Penske—the person greeting our customers when they arrive and the one sending them off with a smile.


Why join Penske as a Customer Service Representative, you ask? It’s simple. Maybe you’ve always had an interest in vehicle maintenance but haven’t had the chance to pursue it. This is the perfect place to start. No experience is required. We will introduce you to our vehicle maintenance processes. We will teach you how to use our leading-edge technology. In fact, the training and experience you get here will help you advance to become a technician. And you’ll get to do that learning at a company that offers career stability and competitive benefits. Talk about an amazing opportunity.


It’s about going above and beyond for our customers—the way Penske goes above and beyond for you. It’s about building meaningful relationships. It’s about keeping our customers moving forward.


**Main Responsibilities:**


* Greeting our customers and making sure they have a great experience as you fuel and wash vehicles


* Performing vehicle readiness inspections to make sure tires, fluids, and other basic maintenance items are done


* Helping make sure our facilities are clean, safe environments for our customers and associates


* Building your skills through training and hands-on coaching to perform minor repairs such as installing mounted tires, replacing or rotating tires and performing preventive maintenance repairs


* Completing other projects and tasks as assigned by supervisor


**Why Penske is for You:**


* Competitive starting salary


* Shift Premiums


* Career stability


* Opportunity for growth


* Excellent benefits, including lots of time off


* Strong, well-rounded training programs


* Advanced vehicle maintenance technology


* Location and schedule flexibility


**General Requirements:**


* High school diploma, equivalent, or prior work experience preferred


* Valid driver’s license required


* Excellent customer service and communication skills


* The ability to work well as part of a team


* The ability and willingness to work outside


* Basic mechanical ability and tool usage (preferred)


* Basic computer skills


* The associate will be required to understand and comply with specific instructions, guidelines, rules, regulations, or other information established by Penske management


* The associate must be able to perform all work adhering to DOT, OSHA, and all Penske safety and maintenance policies; including but not limited to the correct selection and use of appropriate tools, PPE, machine guarding, and established best safety practice.


* Regular, predictable, full attendance is an essential function of the job


* As this position requires driving Penske and customer vehicles, it is regulated by the DOT and requires a current driver qualification file to be maintained as required by the role. The driver qualification file includes: an annual motor vehicle records (MVR) check, a successfully completed DOT Physical, and Safety Performance History records request from prior employers in the last 3 years. Additionally, CDL holders will have a DOT Drug Screening within 30 days of start and subject to a FMCSA Clearinghouse review.


* Willingness to work the required schedule, work at the specific location required, complete Penske employment application, submit to a background screening (to include criminal checks, past employment and education), the ability to pass a drug screen and physical as required by the Department of Transportation, and potential travel within a near geography for training are required.


This position is regulated by the Department of Transportation or designated as safety sensitive by the company, and the ability to work in a constant state of alertness and in a safe manner is required. Associates must have the ability to accept responsibility for their own safety, as well as the safety of others.


**Physical Requirements:** The physical and mental demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


* While performing the duties of this job, the associate will be required to move frequently, stand, walk, climb, bend, and sit for extended length of time throughout their scheduled working period.


* The associate is required to use their hands on a routine and daily basis to grasp, reach, touch, handle, feel, and/or otherwise operate required tools or controls.


* The associate must be able to work safely at heights using applicable ladders and elevated working platforms.


* The associate must be able to safely work in all weather conditions.


* Given the frequent movement of large trucks through the workplace, the associate must be able to see and hear in order to safely navigate the work environment.


* The associate must be able to regularly lift and/or move up to 50lbs/23kg and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100lbs/45kg.


Penske is an Equal Opportunity Employer


Job Category: Vehicle Maintenance/Mechanics/Technicians


Job Family: Vehicle Maintenance


Address: 48 3rd Street


Primary Location: US-NJ-Kearny


Employer: Penske Truck Leasing Co., L.P.


Req ID: 2411755

title: Talent Acquisition Consultant II - Global Corporate & Investment Banking and Global Markets
description:
**Job Description:**


At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.


One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.


Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization.


Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!

**Job Description:**  

This job is responsible for managing the end-to-end hiring process which includes understanding business needs, developing and executing a sourcing strategy, screening/interviewing candidates, managing critical work within a specific Line of Business (LOB), and offering extensions. Key responsibilities include partnering with senior leaders within the business and across Human Resources (HR) to achieve hiring objectives for assigned business units.


The **Global Corporate & Investment Banking and Global Markets** **Executive Recruiter** will be highly regarded with an excellent track record in his or her current environment. The position will be responsible for helping to develop and maintain strong relationships with Business Executives and Human Resources leaders to provide strategic direction and tactical execution of talent acquisition strategy and support and drive business objectives. This is a high impact role supporting a fast paced organization that has a strong talent mindset. The successful candidate must possess mature and sound judgment, integrity, and self-confidence with a strong desire to succeed.

**Responsibilities:**

* Develop appropriate and consistent communication routines with hiring Executives to ensure a client and candidate centric recruiting experience.
* Provide advice, counsel and information to the businesses to enable them to improve their ability to attract strong talent to the firm and best leverage available resources.
* Ensure candidates receive a best in class experience at all touch points throughout the recruitment process.
* Understand the talent profile for success internally as well as external talent market
* Develop and implement strategies to broaden our diversity pipeline. Support diversity efforts through search work.
* Ensure strong compliance in the hiring process.
* Conducts intake sessions with hiring managers to understand the business needs and manages requisition workbench within the applicant tracking system
* Oversees the process for creating a pipelines of candidates for critical skills areas by developing and executing a sourcing strategy, cold calling, and candidate assessment through in-depth phone screens/interviews to identify, attract, and recruit quality talent
* Manages the relationship with senior Human Resources (HR) leaders, which includes coordinating regular routines and reporting on open positions, new hires, and business specific initiatives
* Facilitates creating a more diverse and inclusive workplace by ensuring that the hiring process leverages a pool of candidates with varied backgrounds and experiences
* Ensures compliance with all legal aspects of recruiting and candidate selection including applicable federal and state recruitment regulations including The Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs and Equal Employment Opportunity Commission

**Required Qualifications:**

* Minimum 8 years of experience in Talent Acquisition or Human Resources in a large complex financial services organization or comparably demanding environment with a proven track record of advancement, leadership and business success.
* Previous experience in or in support of GCIB or Global Markets businesses.
* Excellent client relationship skills. Business focused proactive approach to recruiting work. Ability to quickly establish credibility with line executives.
* Deep understanding of recruitment processes, including experience with candidate sourcing tools and methods; strong ability to assess and select talent; strong negotiation skills and attention to detail required. Knowledge of applicant tracking systems and other data management tools desired.
* Strong interpersonal skills and organizational savvy; listens and communicates in a direct, succinct manner; able to navigate within a large corporate environment and influence key internal clients and stakeholders.
* Thrives in fast-paced, high intensity environment with multiple competing demands. Strong work ethic and drive for results.
* Strong ability to collaborate and work within a team context; able to coach and motivate team members within a production environment.
* Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills.
* Practical, results-oriented, business perspective.
* Professional demeanor; outstanding communication and presentation skills.
* Unquestionable business and personal integrity, and values congruent with those of the organization.

**Skills:**

* Active Listening
* Attention to Detail
* Critical Thinking
* Executive Presence
* Presentation Skills
* Decision Making
* Recruiting
* Relationship Building
* Reporting
* Written Communications
* Advisory
* Business Analytics
* Fiscal Responsibility

**Shift:**


1st shift (United States of America)**Hours Per Week:**


40**Pay Transparency details**


US - NY - New York - 1114 Avenue Of The Americas - Grace (NY1544)
Pay and benefits information
Pay range
$110,000.00 - $160,000.00 annualized salary, offers to be determined based on experience, education and skill set.
Discretionary incentive eligible
This role is eligible to participate in the annual discretionary plan. Employees are eligible for an annual discretionary award based on their overall individual performance results and behaviors, the performance and contributions of their line of business and/or group; and the overall success of the Company.

This role is currently benefits eligible. We provide industry-leading benefits, access to paid time off, resources and support to our employees so they can make a genuine impact and contribute to the sustainable growth of our business and the communities we serve.

title: Merchant Market Manager
description:
**Job Description:**


Job Description
At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.


One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.


Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization.


Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!

**Job Description:**  

This job is responsible for leading a team of field-based Merchant Consultants who provide payment processing solutions to small business clients via 1:1 partnerships with small business specialists, financial centers, and other internal partners. Key responsibilities include partnering with internal leaders to create an integrated experience for clients and managing team performance. Job expectations include having knowledge of the payment processing industry and client segment to execute customer-driven sales strategies, and drive exceptional client care.

**Responsibilities:**

* Drives accountability and delivers balanced performance against aligned market goals including assigned sales and revenue goals, operational excellence, risk management, and client experience standards
* Executes customer-driven strategies and tactics that drive exceptional client care and deepen client relationships across the bank
* Coaches Merchant Consultants to drive accountability, deepen knowledge of merchant solutions, and develop effective consultative sales skills through joint calling efforts, call listening, and market visits
* Monitors key performance trends, behaviors, and pipeline development
* Builds relationships with internal banking leaders across the Enterprise to develop partnership strategies and tactics to deliver an integrated and seamless experience for clients
* Manages complex large scale initiatives for a global company, driving timely decisions and acts as a champion for clients by connecting them with expertise across the company to help achieve their goals

**Managerial Responsibilities:**  

This position may also have responsibilities for managing associates. At Bank of America, all managers at this level demonstrate the following responsibilities, in addition to those specific to the role, listed above.

* Diversity & Inclusion Champion: Models an inclusive environment for employees and clients, aligned to company D&I goals.
* Manager of Process & Data: Demonstrates deep process knowledge, operational excellence and innovation through a focus on simplicity, data based decision making and continuous improvement.
* Enterprise Advocate & Communicator: Communicates enterprise decisions, purpose, and results, and connects to team strategy, priorities and contributions.
* Risk Manager: Ensures proper risk discipline, controls and culture are in place to identify, escalate and debate issues.
* People Manager & Coach: Provides inspection, coaching and feedback to motivate, differentiate and improve performance.
* Financial Steward: Actively manages expenses and budgets in alignment with objectives, making sound financial decisions.
* Enterprise Talent Leader: Assesses talent and builds bench strength for roles across the organization.
* Driver of Business Outcomes: Delivers results by effectively prioritizing, inspecting and appropriately delegating team work.

**Skills:**

* Coaching
* Customer and Client Focus
* Payment Processing
* Performance Management
* Pipeline Management
* Business Development
* Issue Management
* Oral Communications
* Retention
* Written Communications
* Credit Documentation Requirements
* Financial Analysis
* Interpret Relevant Laws, Rules, and Regulations
* Leadership Development
* Recruiting

**Required Qualifications:**

* 2+ years’ experience working with Small to Medium-sized Businesses
* 2+ years Leadership experience
* Job expectations includes 80% travel

**Desired Qualifications:**

* Small Business financial services sales experience
* Management of multi-locations
* Merchant Services experience
* Understanding of business credit and financial statements

title: Part-Time Facilities Supervisor - Library
description:
**Description**
---------------


**ABOUT RAMAPO COLLEGE**:


Ramapo College of New Jersey (RCNJ) develops ethical leaders who serve as change agents across all sectors. The College’s unique interdisciplinary academic structure, its liberal arts core, its size (approximately 5,500 students), and its setting in the foothills of the Ramapo Mountains on the New Jersey/New York border provide an optimal environment for individualized, student-centered learning and leadership development. RCNJ’s designation as “New Jersey’s Public Liberal Arts College” by the State legislature is the foundation from which the College’s commitment to an accessible and transformative undergraduate and graduate education is realized.


Established in 1969, *CondeNast Traveler* named Ramapo one of the 50 Most Beautiful College Campuses in America. The barrier-free campus occupies 300 acres and is home to 52 bachelor’s degree programs spanning the arts, business, data science, humanities, education, nursing, social work, social sciences, and the sciences. Ramapo College boasts an average student/faculty ratio of 16:1 and an average class size of 21; affording students the opportunity to develop close ties to the College’s exceptional faculty. In addition, the College offers graduate programs leading to master’s degrees in Accounting, Applied Mathematics, Business Administration, Contemporary Instructional Design, Computer Science, Creative Music Technology, Data Science, Educational Leadership, Nursing, Social Work, and Special Education, as well as a Doctor of Nursing Practice. Every degree program is designed and delivered through the collaborative and interdisciplinary efforts of student-centered faculty scholars and staff who are committed to serving the public good through the delivery of an academically rigorous, inclusive, and a transformative collegiate experience. Ramapo is ranked #1 among New Jersey public institutions by *College Choice* and is recognized as the State’s top college on the list of Best Disability Schools by *Great Value Colleges*. Further commendations include designation as a “Military Friendly College” in *Victory Media’s Guide to Military Friendly Schools*, and as a leading college by *U.S. News & World Report*, *Kiplinger’s*, *Princeton Review,* and *Money* *Magazine*, among others.

**JOB SUMMARY**: Position reports to the Dean of the Library and Learning Commons. This part-time position will perform as the Evenings and Weekends Facility Supervisor/Events Manager. Will actively supervise the entire Peter P. Mercer Learning Commons building and report any problems, issues or damages.  

  

**PAY - $30/hr. - up to 25 hours per week**  

**Hours - 7:00 p.m. to Midnight - Days worked may be Sunday through Thursday (TBD)**
**Examples of Duties**
----------------------


**DUTIES:**  

* Open and close the Peter P. Mercer Learning Commons and provide individuals with access to areas within the Learning Commons, as needed and appropriate.
* Frequently tour all areas and floors of the Learning Commons to insure a safe operating environment on evenings and weekends and during events.
* Supervise and assist those facilitating events in the Learning Commons space.
* Arrange for replacement staff as needed.
* Have basic knowledge and ability to operate technology and audio/visual equipment throughout the Learning Commons.
* Be familiar with, follow, and enforce all College policies and procedures for all Learning Commons tenants and patrons; report infractions/violations to appropriate personnel/supervisors.
* Have knowledge of daily and ongoing activities and events occurring in the Learning Commons.
* File miscellaneous reports, including incident reports to Public Safety, and correspondence as needed.
* Perform the Learning Commons opening and closing checklist during each work shift.
* Ensure the timely submission of work order requests for issues brought to the attention of the Learning Commons tenants or the Facility Supervisor, as appropriate.

**Qualifications**
------------------


**EDUCATION**  

Bachelor's Degree  

  

**KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES**  

Demonstrated communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills.  

Must be reliable and prompt for scheduled shifts.  

Ability to de-escalate situations and resolve conflict.


**Supplemental Information**
----------------------------


**EEO Statement:**  

Ramapo College is an Affirmative Action/Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Ramapo has a long history of advocating, advising, and supporting diversity, equity, and inclusiveness. Examples can be found in its mission statement, strategic plans, degree and course offerings, community outreach programs, and other diversity programs. Ramapo’s commitment to diversity and inclusion is infused across all facets of the College; where the environment is welcoming, dedicated to social justice, respectful of freedom of expression, focused on educating and having an ongoing conversation regarding cultural competence and the benefits and importance of diversity.
The SAME program allows candidates, who identify as having a significant disability, to apply for non-competitive and unclassified positions through a fast track hiring process. For more information about the SAME program and the Fast Track Hiring program, please go to https://www.nj.gov/csc/same/overview/index.shtml if you have any questions, please email, or call the contact as indicated on the job vacancy announcement.


***P******lease send an email to*** ***jehlerma@ramapo.edu*** ***confirming you applied through the NJ SAME program.***

title: Insurance Sales Representative
description:
#### **Job Description**


Join Londiaz Agency Corp, a reputable insurance agency rooted in Norwalk, Connecticut, where we prioritize building strong local connections to better serve our community. We are seeking a dedicated Insurance Sales Representative who can offer personalized service that goes the extra mile. In the heart of Norwalk, you will be an integral part of our team, providing top-notch insurance solutions while fostering meaningful relationships with our clients.


If you are passionate about delivering exceptional customer service, enjoy a collaborative work environment, and strive to be a valuable asset to a growing agency that values its employees, Londiaz Agency Corp is the place for you. Don't miss the opportunity to join our team and make a difference!


Salary: $50000.00 - $70000.00 per year

Annual Base Salary + Commission + Bonus Opportunities


Career Growth Opportunities


Mon-Fri Schedule


Health Insurance


Hands on Training


Paid Time Off (PTO)


Flexible Schedule


Evenings Off

 **Responsibilities**  

Client Consultation: Engage with clients to understand their insurance needs and tailor insurance solutions accordingly.


Inbound Calls: Manage incoming calls from clients, addressing inquiries and providing relevant information.

title: McDonalds Crew Member- In Person, Walk-In Interviews
description:
**Crew Team Member**

McDonald’s cares about their employees and that’s why we provide them with an opportunity to learn, grow, and succeed every day. By offering industry-leading education programs and world-class training, we provide opportunities that inspire confidence and foster valuable skills to help employees thrive wherever they are on their journey, whether they stay at McDonald’s or go elsewhere. There is a reason more than 80% of employees are proud to work at McDonald’s and would recommend working at one of our restaurants. A Crew Team Member at McDonald’s is more than just a paycheck – it’s a chance to gain life skills and grow as an individual. And for anyone willing to take advantage of these opportunities…we’re committed to becoming America’s Best First Job! Our Team Members make $15 per hour.

**Our Benefits:**

401(k) Plan

Competitive Wages

Flexible Schedules

College Tuition Assistance- up to $2,500 yearly

Health, Dental and Vision Insurance

PTO-Paid Time Off

Employee Meals-discounted

National Employee Discount

Employee Recognition Program

Discounts to everyday essentials, movies and restaurants\\*

Discounts to phone plans\\*

Friendly work environment with growth opportunities

Employee events and celebrations

\\*Through McDParks

**See a day in the life of a Crew Team Member at McDonald's**

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DiaN61vWY3A&feature=youtu.be

**Requirements:**

If you're looking for a part-time job that supports your full-time ambition, you've come to the right place. Crew member opportunities are available practically anytime: breakfast, lunch, late nights, weekends - whatever.

You'll find out that a McDonald's crew job can help you grow with top notch training as well as our Archways to Opportunity education programs that offer high school completion courses, upfront college tuition assistance and English Language courses. McDonald's can take you anywhere, and give you the benefits you need for your life while doing so.

**So what does a member of our Crew Team get to do??**

* Connect with customers to ensure they have a positive experience
* Help customers order their favorite McDonald's meals
* Prepare all of McDonald’s World Famous food
* Partner with other Crew and Managers to meet daily goals and have fun
* Keep the restaurant looking fantastic

All you'll need is an outstanding attitude, willingness to learn and grow and the capability to excel in a fast-paced, team environment. We'll teach you the rest. For job openings on your schedule - part time or full time - give us a try. You must be 16 years of age or older to work as a Crew Member at McDonald's.

**Additional Info:**

This job posting contains some information about what it is like to work in a McDonald’s restaurant, but it is not a complete job description. People who work in a McDonald’s restaurant perform a number of different tasks every day, and this posting does not list all of the essential functions of this job.

By applying to this position, I understand that I am applying to work at a restaurant that is owned and operated by an independent franchisee, not McDonald’s USA. I understand that this franchisee is a separate company and a separate employer from McDonald’s USA. Any information I provide in this application will be submitted only to the independent franchisee, who is the only company responsible for employment matters at this restaurant. I recognize that the independent franchisee alone will make all decisions concerning employment matters, including hiring, firing, discipline, supervision, staffing and scheduling. By applying for a job at a franchisee operated restaurant, I understand that the information I provide will be forwarded to the franchisee organization in order for that organization to reach out to me and process and evaluate my application. I acknowledge that McDonald’s USA will not receive a copy of my employment application and will have no involvement in any employment decisions regarding me, including whether I receive an interview or whether I am hired to work for the franchisee. I understand that I need to contact the franchise organization for information about its privacy practices.

title: Outreach Worker/Peer Support Specialist
description:
**NORTH JERSEY COMMUNITY RESEARCH INITIATIVE**

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

**Job Title:** Peer Support Specialist

**Department:** Behavioral Health Services (ECI-OMH Project)

**Reports to:** Project Manager

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Provide peer support services.
* Deliver outreach services in the community to active substance users and their sex partners.
* The PRNs will complete on-site training and will also attend Certified Peer Recovery Specialist training before beginning service delivery.
* Provide outreach and recruitment, education and referrals, mentoring, and ongoing support and follow-up to ensure clients remain in programming and receive the services they need.
* Conduct peer support groups to increase retention in services and peer support.
* Conduct home visits and street outreach to project participants who have dropped out of the project or who have relapsed and invite them to return for follow up.
* Create and maintain confidential records of contacts and referrals made and submit them weekly to the Senior Case Manager and Project Coordinator.
* Create and maintain confidential outreach progress notes.
* Document all services in accordance with the dictates of funding contracts.
* Participate in weekly staff meetings
* Prepare and submit reports to the Project Manager as required.

**JOB QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Previous formal training in substance abuse and hepatitis prevention, care or treatment is preferred.
* HIV/hepatitis education, public speaking and street outreach experience preferred.
* Experience in peer counseling, experience educating those at high risk regarding substance abuse and HIV/hepatitis harm reduction.

**NOTICE:**

NJCRI is a multi-service community agency which provides many facets of services from Infectious Disease Specialist, Primary Medical Care, Transgender Medical Care, Hormone Therapy, Behavioral Health Services, Substance Use Services, Case Management, LGBTQ Services, PrEP Services, Food Pantry, Clinical Research and Trails, Homeless Drop-In, Community Outreach, Syringe Exchange, etc.). We are proactive in ensuring we put in safety measures to assure our agency is safe for our staff and patients especially during the COVID-19 pandemic. Because we specialize in Infectious Diseases, you may be called upon by the agency to assist with COVID 19 prevention-related task.

title: Finance Bid/Proposal Associate
description:
**Finance Bid/Proposal Associate**

**About Us:**

Metro One LPSG is the U.S. leader in providing dedicated security and loss prevention services to national clients. We are a rapidly growing organization transforming the contract security industry and we need talented, committed and determined individuals to help us carry out our mission. Our environment is dynamic, committed to “dedicated service delivery” to our clients and a “best in class” employee experience for our thousands of security and LP officers.

**Job Summary:**

Metro One is seeking a **Finance Bid/Proposal Associate** to support the creation of proposals by collecting essential data for Requests for Proposals (RFPs), Requests for Quotes (RFQs), and Requests for Information (RFIs), among other documents. This role involves contributing to and communicating the strategic direction for pricing preparation by conducting in-depth research on clients, industry trends, and competitors.

**Qualifications:** 

* Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, finance, business, or other relevant discipline preferred
* Minimum of 3 - 5 years of contract bid experience preferred
* ***Advanced skills in Microsoft excel is a must***
* Must be able to string together multiple sheets, advanced formulas, pivot tables, error checking, etc. VBA and Marco ability a big plus
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Strong organizational skills as well as attention to detail
* High degree of organizational ability and strong project management skills.
* Strong work ethic, with a drive to learn, collaborative spirit, and can-do/will-do attitude
* Detail-oriented approach, and not afraid to take on a challenge
* Must be willing to participate in the Company’s pre-employment screening process and continuously meet any applicable state, county and municipal requirements

**Responsibilities:**

* Supports production of proposals by gathering data needed to complete Request for Proposals (RFP), Request for Quotes (RFQs), Request for Information (RFIs) among others.
* Contributes to and communicates the strategic direction of the RFP pricing preparation by performing the necessary research of the client, industry, competition, etc.
* Effectively facilitates calls with key team members to discuss client-specific issues.
* Maintains thorough knowledge of our services, value proposition and new initiatives as they are introduced.
* Applies critical, analytical, and strategic thinking skills and translates technical and information into identifiable excel sheets.
* Integrates data for client-specific proposals incorporating specific tables as required.
* Follow up with contributors and subject matter experts as needed.
* Prepares high-quality and accurate spreadsheet in accordance with agreed-upon strategies, requirements and expectations under the pressure of changing timelines and ensures timely deliverables.
* Assists in creating an internal information library.
* Provides clear, timely, and consistent written and verbal communication.

Metro One LPSG is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to embracing diversity.

title: Cleaner Part Time
description:
**Job Title**


Cleaner Part Time**Job Description Summary**


The Cleaner will work under the supervision of the Custodial Manager or Supervisor and perform a variety of custodial duties for C&W Services. Such duties shall be in accordance with established standards, instructions, and procedures of C&W Services.**Job Description**

**TYPICAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Sweep, mop, and wash floors, and other surfaces (inside buildings).
* Use light and heavy (commercial type) floor (buffers) and shampoo machines including attachments.
* Vacuum rugs in offices and public areas. Spot clean daily and shampoo when directed rugs. Clean and dust furniture, exhibit cases, pictures, chairs, door trim, light fixtures, and all other horizontal surfaces including periodic high dusting.
* Wash windowsills; glass in interior doors, partition, and specified windows.
* Wash glass and trim at entrance doors, interior/exterior- Wash/spot clean interior walls as appropriate daily.
* Clean bathrooms and restock paper supplies daily. Standard bathroom procedures are to damp wipe glass surfaces, empty waste baskets, service soap and toilet paper dispensers, dust sills, clean tile walls, shelves, stall partitions, sweep/mop/scrub floors, etc.
* Monitors possible defects such as clogged urinals and lights out, and reports to supervisors.
* Collect building trash daily placing it in approved container and place in designated collection area for subsequent removal.
* Replace liners in waste baskets and trash containers per specs.
* Sweep or shovel snow from steps and walkways at building entrances and connecting walkways/sidewalks as directed.
* Performs periodic work: High dusting, leather and wood surface, polishing, wall washing.
* Any and all other duties as assigned.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* Basic cleaning responsibilities requires no previous experience
* Must be able to take direction, to work with minimal supervision, and to function cooperatively as part of a team
* Ability to use cleaning tools and equipment.
* Use a portable vacuum cleaner – back pack style.
* Requires attention to detail, a pride in delivering excellent service, organization, and high levels of energy and endurance.

  


Cushman & Wakefield also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health, vision, and dental insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life, and disability insurance programs, and paid and unpaid time away from work. In addition to a comprehensive benefits package, Cushman and Wakefield provide eligible employees with competitive pay, which may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, total hours worked, job type, business line, and applicability of collective bargaining agreements.  


The compensation that will be offered to the successful candidate will depend on factors such as whether the position is covered by a collective bargaining agreement, the geographic area in which the work will be performed, market pay rates in that area, and the candidate’s experience and qualifications.  


The company will not pay less than minimum wage for this role.  


The compensation for the position is: $15.13 - $18.00
C&W Services is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.
In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act Amendments Act (ADAAA), if you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation in order to apply for a position at Cushman & Wakefield, please call the ADA line at **1-888-365-5406** or email **HRServices@cushwake.com**. title: Media Relations Manager
description:
**Job Description:**


At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.


One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.


Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization.


Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!

**Job Description:**  

This job is responsible for providing external communications support, working closely with enterprise and business leaders. Key responsibilities include developing and executing media relations strategies supporting lines of business, subject matter experts, products and platforms, thought leadership, and awards. Job expectations include developing relationships with financial and mainstream media, handling media inquiries, preparing spokespeople for and facilitating interviews, and maintaining integration across the media team, with leaders and support partners throughout the company.


Located in New York, NY, this individual will be responsible for providing external communications support for Bank of America’s Global Corporate and Investment Bank and Global Markets businesses, as well as play a critical role supporting the company’s quarterly earnings and corporate finance announcements and disclosures. The person in this role will work closely with these lines of business and media relations colleagues to further enhance proactive media engagement and initiatives that drive brand awareness and business growth.

**Responsibilities:**

* Serves as a trusted external communications advisor to enterprise and business leaders and other internal stakeholders
* Builds and deepens relationships with members of financial and mainstream media
* Develops and executes media relations strategies within a highly proactive team, promoting subject matter experts, products and platforms, thought leadership, new initiatives, and awards
* Handles incoming media inquiries and interview requests; prepares spokespeople for and facilitates interviews
* Develops and edits content for external use, including press releases, award submissions, briefing materials, and more
* Maintains consistent integration and interaction with colleagues across external and internal communications, marketing, public policy, human resources, and legal
* Serves as day-to-day contact for agency to provide direction, feedback, and guidance on the execution of various external communications campaigns
* Work collaboratively across the Bank’s business units to research and communicate key financial information and regularly interact with media on topics including the bank’s financial statements

**Skills:**

* Critical Thinking
* Executive Presence
* Issue Management
* Oral Communications
* Written Communications
* Business Acumen
* Customer and Client Focus
* Influence
* Innovative Thinking
* Strategy Planning and Development
* Collaboration
* Consulting
* External Resource Management
* Networking
* Problem Solving

**Required Qualifications:**

* 5-7 years of relevant media relations experience with a demonstrated history of driving results
* Strong writing skills and financial experience
* Knowledge of Investment Banking/Global Markets businesses and finance industry generally
* Understand financial statements and have the ability to simplify statements to communicate key messages to the media
* Risk, crisis and issues management abilities
* Integrate work in a fast-paced and highly matrixed environment, establish priorities and achieve results.
* Strong relationship management and communication skills, with a sense of urgency and thoughtfulness
* Individual who thrives in a high intensity environment with multiple and competing priorities
* Unquestionable business and personal integrity and values in line with those of the organization

**Minimum Education Requirement:** High School Diploma / GED / Secondary School or equivalent

**Shift:**

title: Part-Time Development Associate
description:
**Riverside Immigrant Services & Empowerment (Riverside) is an immigrant integration center in**

New York City that supports the economic mobility and social inclusion of newly arrived

immigrants, refugees, and asylum seekers.

**OUR MISSION**

To help new immigrants successfully integrate into life in the U.S. by rapidly improving their

English language skills, providing wrap-around case management and counseling, and offering

workforce development skills building, a digital literacy clinic, and civics instruction. These

supports and skills ensure that Riverside program participants are better positioned to access

job training, employment, higher education, and other opportunities.

**POSITION DESCRIPTION**

Riverside seeks a part-time Development Associate to support the organization’s fundraising

efforts to build capacity and expand programs and services. This is an exciting opportunity for a

passionate, motivated professional interested in advancing their career in nonprofit fundraising.

The Development Associate will report to the Executive Director. The successful candidate will

be highly detail-oriented, computer savvy, able to manage multiple projects simultaneously, and

able to work both collaboratively with the team and autonomously at times. The responsibilities

of this role include:

**Fund Development**

● Process donations and prepare acknowledgment letters and other correspondence.

● Create monthly fundraising reports and dashboards.

● Send appropriate documentation to process contributions from supporters.

● Manage Kindful CRM and communicate accordingly with various stakeholders (Board of

Directors and Executive Director) with updates.

● Maintain foundation, corporation, and individual donor files (on the database and cloud

drive).

● Conduct preliminary research on prospective corporate, foundation, and individual

donors.

● Reconcile donations with the Finance Team monthly.

● Handle all administrative details associated with fundraising (i.e., draft documents, set

up meetings, coordinate events).

● Coordinate production and mailing of year-end appeal letters.

**Events and Volunteers**

● Maintain guest lists, gather and prepare registration materials, and perform other duties

as assigned for fundraising events.

● Collect and track volunteer hours.

● Organize volunteer events in collaboration with the Executive Director.

● Manage logistics and provide on-site support for the annual International Food Festival.

● In coordination with the Executive Director and Board of Directors, prospect

sponsorships for the annual event.

**Communications**

● Prepare public-facing materials for distribution (i.e., copying, filing, mailing, e-mailing).

● Assemble media and donor kits for events and meetings.

● Other duties as assigned by the Executive Director.

**Requirements**

A successful candidate will have some combination of the experience and skills listed below:

● An understanding and commitment to the organization's mission of supporting and

advancing the immigrant community.

● Bachelor's degree in a related field. A minimum of three years experience in a

fundraising position, preferably in a not-for-profit development office.

● Ability to communicate clearly, concisely, and professionally—both verbally and in

writing—as well as strong interpersonal skills.

● Experience composing clear and compelling formal communications (appeals, narrative

drafts, acknowledgments).

● Ability to efficiently manage several projects simultaneously while prioritizing to meet

respective deadlines; strong organizational and time-management skills are key.

● A proactive task manager and problem solver.

● Experience working with CRM databases.

● Experience working with operational budgets, Excel spreadsheets, and

PowerPoint/Google Slides presentations.

● Experience with email clients (Constant Contact, Mailchimp, Squarespace, WordFly)

**SALARY AND BENEFITS:**

Riverside is committed to practicing salary transparency. The salary range for this part-time

position (19.5 hrs per week) is $32,000 - $40,000.

For consideration, please submit a cover letter and resume to:

info@riversideimmigrantservices.org

Resumes must have a cover letter to be considered. No phone calls.

Riverside is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $32,000.00 - $40,000.00 per year

Expected hours: No more than 19.5 per week

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10024

title: Registered Nurse (RN), Sub acute, PT Nights
description:
Waveny LifeCare Network is currently looking to hire a Registered Nurse (RN) for our skilled nursing facility. This position provides professional, quality resident care in an environment which is safe, pleasant and therapeutic. The role also practices nursing care based on sound medical knowledge and nursing skills. Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

* Provides quality resident care providing assessment, formulating, implementing and evaluating resident care plans.
* Implements resident care according to the medical/nursing care plans assuring sound, accurate and comprehensive care is delivered to each resident
* Gives medications as ordered by the physician in accordance with Waveny LifeCare Network policy assuring residents receive the correct medications and doses while understanding all aspects of medications
* Administers or assists with treatments as ordered or performed by the physician
* Has knowledge of residents’ conditions at all times reporting changes to the appropriate discipline recognizing all physical and psychological conditions.
* Acts as a charge nurse as assigned assuming 8-hour responsibility to recognize and meet residents’ medical/nursing care needs.
* Acts as liaison between resident, family and physician providing continuity of care recognizing the family’s understanding of physician’s orders.
* Performs direct resident care as assigned
* Assures resident education of care plans having residents understand good health habits, special procedures, understanding of diagnosis, medications and discharge planning, if applicable.
* Maintains open communications with members of the interdisciplinary healthcare team.
* Documents on charts accurately, objectively and timely, reflecting problems, approaches, measurable goals and time frames of resident care.
* Communicates appropriate information (personnel problems and residents” conditions) to Nurse Supervisor and Nurse Manager assuring the meeting of physical, social, psychological and spiritual needs of the resident.
* Approaches interpersonal relationships in a manner which avoids antagonism and reduces conflict.
* Assures and maintains a safe and infection free resident environment.
* Recognizes safety hazards and acts upon them appropriately.
* Assures equipment is in good working order and reports any unsafe equipment to Environmental Services immediately.
* Remains knowledgeable in emergency situations and uses equipment, documents and communicates appropriately.
* Recognizes potential infection control problem areas and maintains accountability for adherence to infection control procedures.
* Exercises good judgment in using proper body mechanics to prevent injury to self and others.
* Acts as a role model and assumes a leadership role as designated. **Sets an example by displaying positive qualities and attitudes**
* Provides direction and support to CNAs and other licensed personnel in the implementation of resident care
* Institutes and maintains a cooperative team effort among staff members
* Assists in the training and teaching of CNAs’ required skills
* Reorganizes assignments, as needed, to deal with unexpected changes without comprising resident care
* Continually upgrades and makes changes in job area to assure professional growth and development and that the department meets the needs of the changing market/field.
* Supports, promotes, and projects guest relations and positive images to all visitors, residents, and other Waveny LifeCare Network personnel

Qualification for this role:

Requires a registered nurse licensed in the State of Connecticut. Must have excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work with all levels of people diplomatically and tactfully. Requires the ability to be sensitive to the aging population recognizing geriatric needs. Experience in long-term care required. Licensed staff must have the ability to perform lifting and other strenuous duties.

Waveny LifeCare Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Job Type: Part-time

Expected hours: 24 per week

Medical Specialty:

* Geriatrics

Physical Setting:

* Long term care

* RN: 2 years (Preferred)
* Long term acute care: 1 year (Preferred)
* Supervising: 1 year (Preferred)

* BLS Certification (Preferred)
* RN license (Required)

title: Merrill Associate Market Supervision Manager
description:
**Job Description:**


Merrill Wealth Management is a leading provider of comprehensive wealth management and investment products and services for individuals, companies, and institutions. Merrill Wealth Management is one of the largest businesses of its kind in the world specializing in goals-based wealth management, including planning for retirement, education, legacy, and other life goals through investment advice and guidance.


Merrill’s Financial Advisors and Wealth Management Client Associates help clients pursue the life they envision through a personal relationship with their advisory team committed to their needs. We believe trust comes from transparency. Our trusted advisory teams are equipped with access to the investment insights of Merrill coupled with the banking convenience of Bank of America.


At Merrill, we empower you to bring your whole self to work. We value diversity in our thoughts, business, and within our employees and clients. Our Wealth Management team represents an array of different backgrounds and bring their unique perspectives, ideas and experiences, helping to create a work community that is culture driven, resilient, results focused and effective.

 **Position Overview:**

  

The **Associate Market Supervision Manager (AMSM)** is a member of the Market Leadership Team, along with the Merrill Market Supervision Manager (MSM) and Merrill Client Relationship Manager (CRM). This is a role in which the associates will learn and understand the tasks and responsibilities before taking over a full Market Supervision Manager (MSM) role.

  

This job is responsible for a wide variety of delegated compliance, administrative and business functions related to the Merrill Wealth Management Market Executive's overall managerial responsibilities. This individual functions independently, or with minimal guidance, but must keep the Market Executive informed on significant matters. **The Associate Market Supervision Manager** supports the company's business objectives and contributes to Market profitability by influencing Financial Advisor business practices in ways that minimize regulatory, financial, and reputational risks.

 **Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**

* The AMSM is a direct report to the **Division Supervision Manager (DSM).**
* The AMSM protects the Firm, helps grow the business and serves the client by proactively managing and mitigating risk.
* Functions with guidance and keeps the MWM ME and the other members of the Office Management Team (OMT) informed on significant matters that the AMSM is responsible for handling and determines when the MWM ME should be directly involved.

 **Key Qualifications for the role:**

* The ideal candidate is a self-motivated, client centric individual who has or is able to obtain the following in a specified timeframe: Series 7 (SIE, 7 Top-Off) AND Series 66 (or Series 63 AND Series 65), Series 9 AND Series 10 (or Series 8) or equivalent licenses, and Series 3 or 31 license (If warranted).
* SIE strongly preferred
* If Unlicensed, must successfully pass the AP Reasoning Exam
* Minimum 3-5 years of financial services experience preferred
* Ability to manage risk, make sound decisions with a strong understanding of industry regulations, supervisory requirements, policies/procedures, wealth management concepts, and financial services products
* Ability to speak in terms of client needs and concerns, and coach financial advisors on aligning solutions to goals in a suitable and controlled way
* An appreciation and understanding of our client centric strategy
* Demonstrated understanding of the importance of mitigating risk through segmentation, disciplined investment practices, and documentation
* Analytical skills with ability to identify trends, root cause and effects, and implement improved processes to mitigate risk
* Ability to clearly communicate and collaborate with others
* Possesses time management and organization skills with the ability to prioritize tasks

 **Desired Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
* Good organizational skills, including the ability to effectively plan, organize and prioritize tasks
* Previous experience managing a team of at least 10 including the ability to monitor, influence, negotiate, supervise, and delegate a plus

**Shift:**


1st shift (United States of America)**Hours Per Week:**

title: GCIB / GM KYC Change VP
description:
**Job Description:**


Candidate will be a part of the Know Your Client (KYC) Outreach Change team within the Global Corporate and Investment Bank (GCIB) and Global Markets lines of business.


**The Function**


The Client Outreach team are the front line unit who work with clients as part of meeting Know Your Client (KYC) periodic refresh and remediation requirements. We work in close collaboration with Global Corporate and Investment Bankers and Global Markets Sales to support the Bank’s global regulatory and policy requirements as it relates Client Due Diligence (CDD) documentation collection, with support from Operations and Global Financial Crimes Risk teams.


The team identifies and develops client connections, engages client representatives to obtain KYC documentation, and acts as a coordination point for resolving issues/challenges with respect to client and country specific documentation requirements in a timely manner.


In addition to the ongoing document engagement, individuals within the team keep abreast of global regulatory change that could influence processes, and identify opportunities that enhance the client experience.

**The Role**


The KYC Client Outreach Change team oversee delivery of Front Line Unit (FLU) programs, process engineering, and tools and systems used by the FLU.

**Role Responsibilities**

* Strategic, logical, and creative thinking with performing current state analysis, designing future state processes/solutions, and assist in implementing process improvement opportunities
* Develop flexible project plans based on problem statements to get large teams to get a project from "point A" to "point B"
* Create, define, and adhere to strong success metrics
* Perform gap analysis of current state platform capabilities and needs
* Develop various levels of presentations, including executive presentations, to convey key updates and change proposals
* Perform process mapping in Microsoft Visio
* Implement process design changes designed from analysis including creating training and procedural materials, performing readiness activities for process changes, and completing pre and post testing of change
* Manage multiple deliverables, prioritize work and meet deadlines
* Handle large volumes of data and drive decisions based on data analysis
* Strong work ethic and desire to learn, with a proactive drive to demonstrate ownership and take initiative
* Influence and lead diverse groups to achieve desired results
* Quickly get up to speed on new programs, with strong initiative to get things done themselves
* Partner with GCIB and GM business leaders, other FLU project managers, Operations project managers, data management, and other functions to prioritize core deliverables that maximize business value
* Partner with data management to ensure data change, issue remediation and advancement are appropriately delivered
* Drive a collaborative and output oriented culture

**Required Skills**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience
* 7+ years of multi-year change portfolio management experience in project management, process design, or consulting within the financial services industry
* Understand big picture and ability to work well independently
* Ability to initiate and build strong relationships with all levels of the organization
* Excellent interpersonal skills for motivation, collaboration and encouragement
* Professional Demeanor: Demonstrating patience, composure, and positive attitude.
* Problem Solving and Decision Making Skills: Thinking analytically, using diverse research skills, applying past experiences to problem resolution, developing multiple resolutions, knowing how to and where to go to resolve problems.
* Flexibility and Adeptness: Handling multiple projects and daily tasks adjust to a changing environment adept to new approaches that improve overall work efficiency and effectiveness.
* Initiative: Identify process improvements, demonstrate a "self-starter" behavior and a willingness to help others, and show potential to require minimal supervision.
* Detailed knowledge of processes, procedures and policies that govern change and technology at Bank of America, including the Bank of America's Enterprise Change Management Policies and Standards
* Expert in Excel (Data Formulas, Pivots, Macros), Business intelligent reporting tools (Tableau, Business Objects), Citizen Developer tools, SQL
* Expert in PowerPoint presentations that effectively communicate key updates and proposals across various levels of leadership

**Shift:**

title: Case Manager (Behavioral Health Services)
description:
**Job Title****:** Case Manager (Full Time)

**Department:** Behavioral Health Services (MAT PDOA)

**Reports to****:** Program Manager/Director

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

1. The Case Manager will complete screenings, including SBIRT, of all new admissions to NJCRI’s medical clinic to determine the need for additional mental health or substance use assessments. If the client meets the criteria for further assessment based on the results of the SBIRT screening, the Medical Case Manager will refer the client on-site by a warm hand off to substance use clinician for further assessment.

2. The Case Manager will also be responsible for the coordination of other services for the client, such as housing, insurance enrollment assistance, and supportive services.

3. The Medical Case Manager will provide screening, referrals and service coordination to 100 Program participants

4. Provide ongoing case management services to coordinate all aspects of care, including behavioral health, primary care, HIV and hepatitis treatment, and other supportive services

5. Conduct initial intake surveys and follow-up interviewers surveys with participants.

6. Develop individualized service plans to project participants to identify substance abuse and other needs and to develop a plan for addressing needs.

7. Deliver client services as described in the grant award.

8. Provide recovery support services.

9. Collaborate with other departments to enhance client services.

10. Document intakes, referrals and follow-up data for monthly reports.

11. Ensure that persons enrolled in the project are are referred and linked with appropriate drug treatment, mental health services, HIV testing and social service agencies.

12. Assists the Project Director in preparing reports.

13. Deliver client services as described in the current grant contracts.

14. Document all services in accordance with the dictates of individual funding contracts.

15. Assist with quality assurance including: administering and collecting client satisfaction surveys and outcomes-based internal evaluations for the Project Director and Project Evaluator.

16. Assist the Director in evaluation and improvement of program services.

17. Interact with other service providers to enhance coordination of services and referrals to the program.

18. Participate in governmental, professional and community committees, task forces, as assigned by the Director and approved by the Chief Executive Director.

19. Foster and preserve a strong team spirit among program staff and volunteers.

20. Enhance one’s professional abilities via continuing education.

21. Attend in-service training, and continuing educational opportunities relating to HIV disease, HIV prevention counseling, substance abuse prevention, case management or other related topics.

The Program Performance Evaluator in the Continuous Quality Improvement (CQI) department will monitor and identify program corporate compliance issues, assist programs develop and improve the quality of services and make recommendations to reduce risk to consumer, employees and the agency as a whole.

title: Care Management Associate-Full Time-Chinese Speaking
description:
The Care Management Associate (CMA) works under the direction of care managers and care management social workers/RN to support the interdisciplinary health care team members across the continuum. The CMA will help to coordinate payer communication, transition plan implementation, delivery of patient documentation, and other duties in support of care management departmental functions. The CMA demonstrates knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the lifespan and can identify each patient’s age-specific needs.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

 Verify members’ eligibility on the first day of the month via ePaces/MyaAbility and notify CM of any disenrollment.  Update members’ alert pages in Dynamo.

 Create authorizations and send to utilization management for approval. Send out auth line letters to service providers and follow up to ensure receipt and document receipt confirmation.

 Assist in conversations with vendors to inquire about scheduled delivery dates or service beginning dates.  Enter medications in Dynamo based on UAS.

 Assist CM with sending BlastFax and finding service providers, especially in difficult-to-serve areas.

 Maintain and update database of authorizations and other data, such as flu and pneumonia events.  Maintain spreadsheets and update all service authorizations and other data, such as pneumonia/flu events and CDPAS docs.

 Schedule non-emergency transportation to and from medical appointments.  Contact providers (PCPs, specialists, LHCSA, CHHA, etc.) to get members’ records or to assist with other necessary requests.  Participate in quality improvement initiatives.

 Support coordination and utilization of services.

 Act as support to team—answer phone, follow up on authorization-related issues (forward all other calls to designated RN/SW Care Manager), assist with making regular and monthly phone calls, send faxes, and assist with problem solving.

 Conduct client satisfaction survey (by mail & telephone).

 Maintain database of community resources.

 Perform all duties in a team environment, demonstrating flexibility in work assignments and a commitment to the Department’s mission and goals.

 Assist with other duties as necessary and assigned.

**Qualifications :**

 High school diploma required. Associate’s Degree preferred.

 Experience in a managed care environment or with insurance benefit verification.

 Excellent customer service and communication skills.

 Computer literate with Microsoft Office proficiency.

 Bilingual Chinese and English preferred.

 Call center experience preferred.

 Demonstrated ability to organize, prioritize work, and work productively in a team structure, with and without direct supervision.

 Possess an understanding of medical terminology, medical diagnosis, or prior experience as a Certified Nurses’ Aide (CNA), Medical Assistant (MA), or Service Coordinator.

title: DSP (Direct Support Professional)
description:
Job Summary:  
We are seeking a compassionate and dedicated Direct Support Professional to join our team of caregivers. The successful candidate will provide individualized support and care to our clients, enabling them to live independently and with dignity. As a Direct Support Professional, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful difference in the lives of individuals with disabilities.

Responsibilities:  
- Provide daily living support to individuals with disabilities, including personal care, meal preparation, and household chores.  
- Assist with medication management and adhere to HIPAA guidelines.  
- Engage in social activities and recreational pursuits with clients, such as cooking, arts, and sports.  
- Monitor and report on the health and well-being of clients, providing first aid when necessary.  
- Collaborate with healthcare professionals, social workers, and other support staff to ensure comprehensive care.  
- Maintain a safe and clean living environment, adhering to home care and home health standards.  
- Promote independence and empowerment among clients, supporting them in their daily routines and goals.  
- Demonstrate a commitment to social work principles, prioritizing client autonomy and dignity.

Requirements:  
- High school diploma or equivalent required.  
- Completion of a certified nurse assistant (CNA) program or equivalent experience preferred.  
- CPR certification required.  
- Experience working with people with disabilities and knowledge of home community care practices.  
- Familiarity with HIPAA regulations and the importance of maintaining confidentiality.  
- Ability to lift and transfer clients safely.  
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills.  
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team.  
- Reliable transportation and a valid driver's license (if applicable).

description:

You will also be collaborative and inclusive in helping our customers while being part of a fun, team-oriented retail culture. Hiring immediately and training in print provided.

* Discounts at hundreds of retailers, restaurants and more

* Dental and vision insurance
* And many more benefits

* Able to work with many customers to provide a total solution

* Ability to collaborate and work cooperatively in a high paced and sometimes stressful environment
* Manage conflict in a reasonable, nonconfrontational and cooperative manner

* Ability to lift and move supplies in the 10 - 50 pound range, stand and walk continuously
