title: Physical Therapy Manager
description:
**Outstanding opportunity in Westchester for a Clinical Manager of Physical Therapy!**

A large medical group with offices in Westchester, NY, is currently looking for a full-time Clinical Manager of Physical Therapy to join their dynamic and passionate team. This role comes with a very competitive salary and benefits package. Please apply for more details!

**Position: Clinical Manager of Physical Therapy - Ambulatory**

The Physical Therapy Manager is responsible for the overall management and supervision of activities in the Physical Therapy department as well as providing direct patient care. This position reports to the Director of Physical Therapy.

**Requirements:**

* 3-5 years of physical therapy experience, preferably in a managerial position in outpatient care
* Proven exceptional customer service and patient care experience
* Self-motivated with the willingness to exceed patient expectations and department standards
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while providing outstanding patient care
* Flexibility to work shifts based on department needs
* Graduation from an accredited Physical Therapy School (Doctorate required)
* Proof of licensure as a Physical Therapist in the State of employment
* Proof of USA employment eligibility
* BLS Certification

**Responsibilities:**

* Manage the day-to-day operations of the clinic
* Supervise, train, and mentor all staff
* Complete performance reviews
* Maintain a safe clinical environment
* Communicate with referring physicians as needed
* Ensure all staff members adhere to billing compliance and productivity standards
* Ensure Medicare compliance and all state and federal regulatory requirements
* Adhere to all HIPAA regulations regarding patient confidentiality and recordkeeping
* Oversee Physical Therapy front desk operations
* Ensure all staff members adhere to patient experience standards
* Ensure all staff members complete documentation accurately and in a timely manner
* Ensure staff compliance with clinical education requirements
* Perform patient evaluations, including all pertinent tests and measures
* Develop a plan of care based on physician's orders and evaluation findings
* Instruct patients in home exercise programs, transfer training, positioning, safety issues, etc.
* Maintain a professional clinical environment, including clinic layout, staff attire, and patient communications
* Maximize departmental resources and participate in new program development
* Perform other diverse duties as directed by the Physical Therapy Director

**Note:** This role is open to candidates who haven't managed before but are looking for their next step, provided they have good longevity in their career. The Physical Therapy Manager also practices and carries a patient load.

The primary function of the Customer Service Associate (CSA) Front End is to assist customers with all of their shopping needs. The CSA Front End is required to respond to customer inquiries and support them throughout their shopping experience including promoting customer loyalty plans and/or extended protection/replacement plans where appropriate. Duties also include processing customer sales and returns by operating a cash register, handling internet and pick-up orders, looking up merchandise information for price matches, and providing assistance to other team members as needed. The CSA Front End is also responsible for addressing customer complaints over the phone and in person. The CSA Front End is expected to maintain a safe and secure work environment by conducting daily safety reviews, noting hazards, keeping store areas clean and organized, and monitoring for potential theft or security risks. Lastly, the CSA Front End is responsible for completing all other duties as assigned.

title: Corporate Coverage Chief
description:
\\*\\*Job Description:\\*\\* \\*\\*The Wall Street Journal seeks an experienced journalist for one of the most important roles at the whole company, Corporate Coverage Chief.\\*\\*



\\*\\*The Corporate Editor is responsible for the Journal’s business coverage and for the team of more than 90 reporters and editors that produces it. The Journal has been leading coverage of business for as long as the newspaper has existed, and you’ll need both to carry on this tradition of excellence and to think creatively and innovatively about how we should do it afresh for a changing world and changing audiences in digital realms.\\*\\*



\\*\\*To succeed in this role, you’ll need a thoroughgoing knowledge of the business world drawn from experience covering it, from startups to tech behemoths. You’ll need the capacity to lead a large team through big news moments and the strategic wisdom to set it on a long-term course. You’ll need ambition and drive and a commitment to daily excellence. This is a topic on which we must be the very best.\\*\\* \\*\\*This is a coverage-chief position. Considerable editing and management experience is required.\\*\\* \\*\\*You will:\\*\\*



+ \\*\\*Set the long-term coverage agenda for the corporate team and oversee the daily news flow.\\*\\*



+ \\*\\*Build, maintain and nurture a top-flight team of reporters and editors.\\*\\*



+ \\*\\*Collaborate with other coverage chiefs and with colleagues throughout the organization to produce great and distinctive journalism.\\*\\*



+ \\*\\*Seek new ways of doing our journalism digitally, and champion them in the newsroom.\\*\\*



+ \\*\\*Represent the Journal publicly at events and conferences, and be a public face for our coverage beyond our doors.\\*\\*



\\*\\*You have:\\*\\*



+ \\*\\*More than 10 years of experience managing reporters or editors.\\*\\*



+ \\*\\*Deep knowledge of companies, the people that run them and the issues they care about.\\*\\*



+ \\*\\*Demonstrated success at managing news coverage and managing longer-term work.\\*\\*



+ \\*\\*The very highest standards of excellence, and a commitment to ambitious and distinctive journalism.\\*\\*



\\*\\*To apply, please provide a resume and cover letter.\\*\\*

Business Area: Dow Jones – News – WSJ



Job Category: Editorial/Journalism



Union Status:



Non-Union role



Pay Range: $290,000 – $340,000



We recognize that attracting the best talent is key to our strategy and success as a company.As a result, we aim for flexibility in structuring competitive compensation offers to ensure we are able to attract the best candidates.The quoted salary range represents our good faith estimate as to what our ideal candidates are likely to expect, and we tailor our offers within the range based on the selected candidate’s experience, industry knowledge, location, technical and communication skills, and other factors that may prove relevant during the interview process.



Pay-for-performance is a key element in our strategy to attract, engage, and motivate talented people to do their best work. Similarly to salary, for bonus eligible roles, targets are set based on a variety of factors including competitive market practice.



For benefits eligible roles, in addition to cash compensation, the company provides a comprehensive and highly competitive benefits package, with a variety of physical health, retirement and savings, caregiving, emotional wellbeing, transportation, and other benefits, including “elective” benefits employees may select to best fit the needs and personal situations of our diverse workforce..



Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.



This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

title: Mailroom Clerk
description:
**Join CloudOps Solution as a Mailroom Clerk – Where Precision and Efficiency Elevate Operations!**

At CloudOps Solution, we lead the way in cloud technology, delivering cutting-edge IT solutions to businesses across the globe. Our success is built on a foundation of innovation, precision, and exceptional customer service. We are seeking an organized and detail-oriented Mailroom Clerk to play a vital role in ensuring smooth mail and package handling, contributing to the efficiency of our fast-paced, dynamic office environment.

**Position Overview:**

As a Mailroom Clerk at CloudOps Solution, you will be a key player in maintaining the flow of communication and logistics within our office. Your efforts will keep operations running smoothly, ensuring that mail and packages are handled with precision and care. If you thrive in bringing order to a busy environment and enjoy managing multiple tasks, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Mail Handling: Efficiently receive, sort, and distribute incoming mail and packages to the appropriate departments, ensuring timely and accurate delivery.
* Outgoing Mail: Prepare and process outgoing mail with precision, including labeling, weighing, and ensuring compliance with postal and shipping regulations.
* Inventory Management: Maintain a well-stocked mailroom with essential supplies, such as postage, packing materials, and other necessary items to keep operations running smoothly.
* Record Keeping: Accurately log incoming and outgoing mail, track deliveries, and resolve any issues swiftly to ensure seamless mailroom operations.
* Customer Service: Provide responsive and professional assistance to staff with mail and shipping inquiries, ensuring smooth communication and efficient service.
* Package Handling: Safely handle and distribute packages, including larger or heavy items, with care and efficiency to meet operational needs.
* Team Collaboration: Work closely with administrative staff and other departments to align mailroom operations with overall company logistics, contributing to the success of the entire office.

**Qualifications:**

* Education: High school diploma or equivalent required.
* Experience: Prior mailroom or administrative experience is preferred but not required—we provide training for the right candidate!

**Why You’ll Love Working at CloudOps Solution:**

* Comprehensive Benefits: Enjoy access to excellent health, dental, and vision insurance, along with a robust retirement plan to support your long-term goals.

* Supportive Work Environment: Join a team that fosters collaboration, innovation, and creativity, while maintaining a positive and inclusive culture.
* Work-Life Balance: Benefit from paid time off, holidays, and a balanced work schedule that allows you to achieve both personal and professional fulfillment.

**Take the Next Step in Your Career with CloudOps Solution!**

If you're ready to be a crucial part of our operational excellence, apply today and join a company that values your contributions and supports your growth every step of the way.

title: Life Insurance Sales Manager (On-Site)
description:
**Life Insurance Sales Manager (On-Site)**

THIS IS AN IN OFFICE POSITION IN NORTHERN NJ...PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU ARE NOT WILLING TO COMMUTE DAILY.

**About Us:** Kingdom First Financial is a leading provider of life and health products, specializing in the sales and distribution of senior products. We are dedicated to empowering individuals and families to protect their financial future. We are passionate about helping our clients make informed decisions and providing them with top-notch service. As we continue to expand our operations, we are seeking a motivated and dynamic Life Insurance Sales Manager.

**Job Description**: As a Life Insurance Sales Manager, you will play a pivotal role in driving the success and growth of our business. Your primary responsibility will be to lead and manage our in-office sales agents, ensuring efficient and effective customer service. You will also earn commissions by successfully enrolling clients, that the company provides, into suitable life insurance plans. We are looking for individuals who have an entrepreneurial mindset and are eager to take ownership of their work. Successful candidates will have the sales knowledge & experience to coach existing agents, while also maintaining their sales goals.

**Responsibilities**:

* Oversee day-to-day operations of the life insurance sales agents, ensuring high-quality customer service and meeting performance targets.
* Recruit, train, and motivate a team of sales agents, providing coaching and guidance to maximize their potential as they sell life insurance plans to consumers.
* Actively participate in the development and execution of business plans, setting ambitious goals and strategies to build a successful branch within the company.
* Answering questions, guiding & assisting agents with difficult calls or application issues
* Assisting management team in identifying trends and strategizing sales goals
* Work with team to achieve sales goals to maximize company growth.
* Model a high level of professionalism and integrity with every consumer and employee interaction.
* Successfully enroll clients in life insurance plans via outbound calls

**Position Requirements**

* MUST work in the East Hanover office.
* High School diploma
* Valid New Jersey Life & Health Insurance license or ability to obtain prior to commencement
* Proven sales, training & management experience
* High level of integrity, and a competitive team player
* Assertive, goal oriented, positive & self-motivated
* Excellent communication skills
* Adapt quickly in fast paced environment.
* Professional demeanor & personal accountability
* Ability to work overtime, if necessary
* Ability to utilize a personal laptop device
* Proficiency with computer applications

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Life Insurance Sales Experience
* Insurance Management Experience
* Bilingual in English & Spanish, a plus
* Proven ability to close sales at a high rate
* Phone sales experience
* College Education a plus

Kingdom First Financial offers you the opportunity to start a career in a family-like environment that is rewarding and cutting edge. We take pride in people our people first! At Kingdom First Financial, you can start a new career path at a company that rewards work ethic and embraces teamwork. We’re proud of the work we do, the culture we’ve built, and we'll make sure to support you on this journey.

Joining us means being part of a hyper-growth company with tons of professional opportunities for you to accelerate your career. Integrity offers our people a competitive compensation package, including benefits that make work more fun and give you and your family peace of mind.

**Pay rate:**

* $2,500 per month guaranteed plus additional earnings through Commissions
* 6 Figure Earning Potential

* Commission pay

title: Associate Enterprise Partner Manager, Grocery & Retail
description:
**About the Role**
  

  

The Uber Eats team is looking for sharp, highly motivated individuals to join our Enterprise team in the Grocery & Retail segment covering some of our most strategic partners. As an Associate Enterprise Partner Manager, you will work efficiently and effectively with our merchant partners to drive revenue growth, operational excellence, and customer service. Associate Enterprise Partner Managers will work closely with merchants, local and central operations, product, sales, marketing and engineering teams to manage and optimize partnerships and provide maximum value for both Uber and its merchant partner.  

  

You will succeed in this role if: you produce your best results in a team environment; you possess an insatiable appetite to continuously learn; you value ideas over hierarchy; customer obsession runs in your DNA.  

  

**What You'll Do**
* Internal and external advocate. Be the merchants' go-to person and navigate internal processes to provide the best outcome for the client and our market
* Bring your analytical A-game. You will be building business models, performing analysis with local/central operations teams s to understand trends, provide actionable insights, and track productivity and success of initiatives to ensure we are driving towards the best possible outcome
* Handle the big picture and the tiny details. You are organized and always on top of your deadlines to ensure nothing gets missed. You also have an eye to the big picture and flourish by creating new ways to add to existing partnerships
* Drive initiatives. You will drive and support key initiatives across our business teams to grow strategic and long term opportunities with our various partners. This involves wearing many hats and jumping in to help your teammates when the needs arise
* Read between the lines. You will be working with stakeholders from various teams such as Product, Marketing, Operations, Legal, Finance, etc.
* Drive day-to-day interactions with our top tier partners
* Employ critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills to navigate relationships


**Basic Qualifications**
* 3+ years of professional experience
* Previous client-facing experience with enterprise/mid-market accounts.
* Previous experience with managing complex data set and tracking/hitting multiple OKRs.
* Consistent track record of successfully handling complex partnerships


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Grocery/CPG and previous partnerships experience preferred
* You will spend the majority of the time working with various internal and external teams, building and cultivating new relationships with potential and existing partners within all parts of an organization.
* You are a self-starter and collaborative leader. Everywhere you go, you cannot help but flex and stretch your analytical powers, pitching in as needed, but also knowing when to take control and lead a conversation with an Engineer, Product Manager, or C-Level Executive
* Product sense. You know what makes a product experience not just good, but amazing. You lead cross-functional teams to create partner integrations that delight users and drive measurable impact
* Speediness and resourcefulness. This team moves fast and always operates in new spaces. You pick up things fast and run with them

  

For Chicago, IL-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$79,000 per year - USD$88,000 per year. For New York, NY-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$88,000 per year - USD$98,000 per year. For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$88,000 per year - USD$98,000 per year. For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

title: Wealth Relationship Manager
description:
Job description
Our purpose – Opening up a world of opportunity – explains why we exist. Here at HSBC we use our unique expertise, capabilities, breadth and perspectives to open up new kinds of opportunity for our more than 40 million customers. We’re bringing together the people, ideas and capital that nurture progress and growth, helping to create a better world – for our customers, our people, our investors, our communities and the planet we all share.


The Wealth Relationship Manager (WRM) works closely with the Wealth Relationship Officer (WRO) and the service teams to build meaningful relationships with high value clients. Professionalism client focus, and understanding of the fundamentals of wealth planning will be key as the WRM acquires, develops, advises, and retains a portfolio of clients.


As the Wealth Relationship Manager, you will:


* Build deep, long-lasting and mutually valuable relationships in which you will provide financial solutions and opportunities to your portfolio of clients
* Maintain the highest standard of excellence in developing strategies to increase wallet share of existing clients and identifying product opportunities within the business through regularly collecting, updating and analyzing client financials
* Conduct full needs assessments with current and potential wealth customers and recommend appropriate banking, investment and insurance products and services to meet individual needs, based on objectives, risk tolerance and proper asset allocations
* Represent the company in community organizations and activities to enhance the Company's image and maintain and grow a referral network for additional relationship opportunities while maintaining an active prospect pipeline. Business development through existing relationships and COI’s (certificate of insurance) will also be expected

For this role, HSBC targets a fixed pay range between $100,000.00 and $200,000.00


The final fixed pay offer will depend on the candidate and a number of variables, including but not limited to, role responsibilities, skill set, depth of experience and education, licensing/certification requirements, internal relativity, and specific work location.


At HSBC, our overall goal is to provide a competitive Total Reward Package, with an appropriate mix of fixed pay, and variable pay, as part of an employee’s overall total compensation and benefits. Variable pay generally takes the form of discretionary, annual awards (sometimes referred to as a “bonus”). Additionally, HSBC offers a wide range of competitive and flexible benefits designed to help you improve your health and well-being, finances, and lifestyle.


Requirements
You´ll likely have the following qualifications to succeed in this role:


* Meaningful experience in nontraditional banking financial sales, providing client recommendations and increasing sales, and building and maintaining valuable relationships with high net worth client portfolios
* Expert knowledge in wealth planning and wealth products, the impact of macroeconomics/microeconomics/local market developments, and of external regulatory framework relevant to wealth management
* Strong client focus and ability to deliver needs-based solutions through effective communication, influencing, and sales skills
* Ability to demonstrate strong relationship deepening skills with existing client base to build and grow relationships and develop referral sources
* Strong business development skills to work with outside COI’s to develop self-sourced business
* Self-Motivated and Self-driven individual with strong relationship and communications skills
* Good understanding of how to work with Compliance, Credit & Risk and Internal Control to ensure a balanced risk operating environment
* Series 7, 63, 65 or 66 (in lieu of 63 and 65), Life and Health insurance licenses required

In compliance with applicable laws, HSBC is committed to employing only those who are authorized to work in the U.S. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. as HSBC will not engage in immigration sponsorship for this position.


As an HSBC employee, you will have access to tailored professional development opportunities to ensure you have the right skills for today and tomorrow. We offer a competitive pay and benefits package including a robust Wellness Hub, all in a welcoming, diverse and inclusive work environment. You will be empowered to drive HSBC’s engagement with the communities we serve through an industry-leading volunteerism policy, a generous matching gift program, and a comprehensive program of immersive Sustainability and Climate Change Initiatives. You’ll want to join our Employee Resource Groups as they play a central part in life at HSBC, including the development of our employees and networking inside and outside of HSBC. We value difference. We succeed together. We take responsibility. We get it done. And we want you to help us build the bank of the future!


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Product Strategist
description:
**Job Description:** **About Our Organization:**


Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).


**About the Role**


Dow Jones' Product Strategy team steers the overall go-to-market commercial strategy for Media & Marketing Sales (MMS). Our goal is to drive advertising revenue across Dow Jones products while delivering business outcomes for our clients.


The PS team is also responsible for educating and supporting sales in approaching the market as brand evangelists with expertise across all revenue-generating Dow Jones products.


The Product Strategist will support the overall goals of the Product Strategy team with a particular focus on Dow Jones' leadership position within the enterprise media, energy and business intelligence space. This includes producing high impact sales enablement materials for our high value clients.


The Product Strategist will collaborate across all MMS teams and have a unique seat at the table with our newsroom partners to develop new products, refine existing ones and set the roadmap for new commercial opportunities.


**You Will:**


* Design and develop strategic narratives that highlight the unique value of DJ products for clients
* Distill complex ideas into accessible go to market materials including: general presentations, calendars, sell sheets and training resources.
* Support PS Directors by attending brainstorms, contributing a POV and ideas - always with a growth mindset
* Liaise with senior newsroom stakeholders in a professional and goal-oriented manner, respectful of the church and state boundaries between editorial and commercial teams
* Act as an internal brand champion and product SME to support sales, integrated marketing, and other client-facing teams
* Present the perspectives of our newsroom to sales, share the why & when to use products and how to best introduce into the media mix.
* Ensure suite of sales materials are accurate and up to date.
* Develop training sessions for newly created products

**You Have:**


* 5+ years marketing experience
* Previous experience working for a publishing brand and/or client(s),
* Experience working across multiple mediums (ad tech, audio, video, events, immersive storytelling, linear tv, and/or social)
* Strong communication skills and experience balancing delicate internal senior stakeholders
* Enterprising mindset with a self-starter approach to problem solving
* A propensity for action (Learn, Do, Share)
* An eye for design, understanding that visuals can help inform a narrative (e.g. proficient in at least one of the following: Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Keynote)
* A keen attention to detail and a knack for storytelling
* Excellent project management and time utilization skills
* Proven Marketing track record of successful materials development and packaging;
* Analytical mindset and comfort using data to diagnose and inform decisions
* A positive attitude and an open mind to learn, with an emphasis on curiosity

**Our Benefits**


* Comprehensive Healthcare Plans
* Paid Time Off
* Retirement Plans
* Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Plans
* Education Benefits
* Paid Maternity and Paternity Leave
* Family Care Benefits
* Commuter Transit Program
* Subscription Discounts
* Employee Referral Program

Learn more about all our US benefits

Union Status:


Union role

We recognize that attracting the best talent is key to our strategy and success as a company.As a result, we aim for flexibility in structuring competitive compensation offers to ensure we are able to attract the best candidates.The quoted salary range represents our good faith estimate as to what our ideal candidates are likely to expect, and we tailor our offers within the range based on the selected candidate's experience, industry knowledge, location, technical and communication skills, and other factors that may prove relevant during the interview process.


Pay-for-performance is a key element in our strategy to attract, engage, and motivate talented people to do their best work. Similarly to salary, for bonus eligible roles, targets are set based on a variety of factors including competitive market practice.


For benefits eligible roles, in addition to cash compensation, the company provides a comprehensive and highly competitive benefits package, with a variety of physical health, retirement and savings, caregiving, emotional wellbeing, transportation, and other benefits, including "elective" benefits employees may select to best fit the needs and personal situations of our diverse workforce..


Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.


This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

title: Analyst, GFO, Treasury
description:
**Job Description:**


**About Our Organization:**


Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).


**About the Role**


Working in the Treasury group you will manage and enhance Treasury policy, processes and platforms to develop and deliver solutions and synergies to the current News Corporation Shared Service model. In addition, you will be a part of the cash management team responsible for liquidity, global payment processing, foreign exchange and bank account rationalization. You will be based in our Princeton, New Jersey office and report to the SVP, Tax & Treasury.


**You Will:**


* Maintain and manage bank account liquidity, including Direct Method Cash Flow forecasting
* Manage global banking relationships
* Be the subject matter expert on global payments and processing and local banking regulations
* Be a Primary Security Administrator across all relationship banks’ online portals
* Initiate and approve internal and external funds transfers via established bank portals
* Identify new opportunities to invest excess global cash balances
* Implement, review and manage Treasury policies
* Perform bank fee comparison and analysis
* Develop and execute foreign exchange risk strategies
* Analyze and Report Foreign Exchange (FX) exposure to management
* Monitor and assess SOX Treasury related compliance
* Perform ad-hoc duties and/or other special projects

**You Have:**


* Minimum 5 years of Treasury Accounting and cash management experience
* Bachelor’s degree in business related area (Preferably Finance or Accounting)
* Strong analytical skills, Excel, Access and other applications
* Familiarity with FIS Integrity Treasury Management System and eBAM (preferred)
* A process and detail oriented skill set
* Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to develop both internal and external relationships
* Strong time management skills and the ability to manage competing deadlines
* Effective written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to work cohesively in a team environment

title: Page Designer
description:
**Job Description:**


The Wall Street Journal is looking for a motivated and creative Page Designer to join our award-winning team of editorial designers. You will be part of a team that provides designs and layout across all of our news sections You will help provide focus and shape to pages and stories alongside multiple stakeholders, including other visual journalists, reporters and editors. You will work closely on assignments provided by section editors to produce visually compelling layouts that reflect WSJ’s journalistic integrity.


You will


* Stays on top of the news schedule and priorities throughout the day.
* Reviews advertising layouts and helps develop a visual plan for each story and page.
* Works closely with an art director to determine how best to tell stories visually and prioritize how to display stories.
* Produces creative layouts and presentation of stories within the boundaries of established styles and design.
* Receives daily assignments and manages time to meet strict edition deadlines.
* Clearly communicates with art director needs and alerts to potential issues
* Assists other team members with their assignments.
* Adheres to and respects established styles.
* Delivers pages that reflect the high journalistic standards of the WSJ.
* Fills in for art director when needed.

You have


* One to five years experience in news layout
* A passion for journalism and excellent news judgment
* Must have good and demonstrable design and typography skills
* Ability to assist reporters and editors understand best practices for visual storytelling.
* Self-motivated and a willingness to learn new tasks in a fast-moving environment.
* Excellent communication and time-management skills.
* Experience with business news and charting a bonus.
* An understanding of XML and CSS.
* Software Requirements: Adobe InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, Acrobat, G Suite,. Experience with EidosMedia’s Methode publishing system a plus.

The position will be based in New York, though other locations will be considered under the right circumstances, and will report to the Deputy Design Chief for News.


To apply, please submit resume, cover letter and portfolio of your design work.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. title: Loss Prevention Store Detective
description:
AJ2Security is seeking experienced retail store detectives to work at our industry leading client’s store locations. We have built a reputation for providing exceptional service to our clients through our highly professional team of detectives. We currently have openings in Brooklyn and Harlem New York.

Job Description:

Store detectives are responsible for protecting the assets of our clients (cash, merchandise, property) as well as ensuring a safe and secure environment by doing the following:

* Watching the activity of customers, employees, vendors, and delivery people for suspicious behavior
* Working undercover in plain clothes to detect and apprehend potential shoplifters
* Using cctv and other security systems to monitor activity in client locations
* Filing complaints with police and testifying in court in regards to apprehensions and investigations which you took part in

Benefits:

Our team is family to us. We make it our priority to ensure you work in a great work environment and under the best of conditions. Your benefits also include:

* Full time, permanent position
* Competitive pay with annual increases
* Medical and Dental Benefits
* Short term disability
* Life Insurance
* Flexible scheduling
* Training program
* Recognition programs
* Opportunity for advancement

Skills Required:

* High degree of professionalism
* Good decision making under pressure
* Ability to work independently
* Strong report writing and communication skills
* Ability to travel to store locations within 60 miles of home
* Ability to work retail store hours

Experience Requirements:

* A minimum of 6 months of verifiable retail store detective experience required (working undercover to detect and apprehend shoplifters)
* New York State Security License is a plus

AJ2 Security is an equal opportunity employer, committed to building a diverse workplace.

title: Analyst/Associate
description:
Position: Analyst/Associate



Department: Abacus Finance Group, LLC



Reports To: President & CEO



Employment Status: Full-Time, Exempt



Office Location: Corporate Office, NY

  


**Job Summary**



The Analyst/Associate will assist with structuring and executing senior secured cash-flow based debt financing transactions for lower-middle market sponsor led LBOs, acquisitions financings and recapitalizations.

  


**Job Specific Responsibilities and Duties:**


* Develop initial screening materials, draft term sheet proposals, perform extensive underwriting due diligence, prepare and seek formal loan approval and assist in closing of transactions
* Prepare comprehensive loan package including write-up of issuer and transaction financial analysis, industry and market trend analysis, financial modeling, and presentation of the potential lending opportunity to the investment committee
* Manage assigned portfolio investments to monitor account performance monitor/report on assigned portfolio and ensure compliance with covenants and other loan documents
* Create presentations for both internal and external use as well as other special strategy related projects that may arise
* Assist in external fundraising efforts and management of third party investor reporting and ad-hoc requests

  


**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree
* Superior academic record and job performance
* 1-3 years professional experience in banking, private credit and/or private equity
* Formal credit training and experience working in small deal teams preferred but not required
* Excellent Excel skills
* Strong written and verbal presentation skills
* Ability to work collaboratively and think independently
* Immediate hire
* Willingness to travel

  


**Abacus Overview:**



Founded in 2011, Abacus Finance is a leading direct lending company, focused on providing cash flow senior financing to private equity/family office-sponsored, lower-middle market companies across diverse industries. Since Abacus's inception, it has closed over $3 billion in financings across 110+ platform companies. The firm targets private debt financing opportunities of up to $50 million and finances companies with EBITDA between $3 million and $15 million.

  



The job description outlined above is considered a core list of job duties/requirements. This document should not be considered a complete or comprehensive list. The incumbent assigned to this position is required to perform the duties listed above. The incumbent is also expected to adapt to changes and/or additions as needed. Emigrant Savings Bank and its Subsidiaries retain and reserve any and all rights to change, modify, amend, add to or delete from any section of this document as it deems, in its judgment, to be proper. title: Sales Development Representative
description:
Runwise is looking for a growth-minded Sales Development Representative (SDR) who wants to jump-start their career on our rapidly scaling and mission-driven sales team.


**The Team**



Runwise (www.runwise.com) is a fast-paced, customer-focused climate-tech startup that controls and runs the key energy systems (heating, water, etc…) in 7500+ buildings throughout the US. Runwise's unique hardware and software service significantly reduces energy usage, substantially lowering costs and carbon output. As of today, Runwise's technology takes the equivalent of 80,000 cars worth of carbon emissions off the road each year.


**The Role**



As an SDR at Runwise, you will be charged with helping Runwise expand our footprint and find our next great customers. You will need to learn industry dynamics, and organization structures, and be a compelling voice to spark prospect interest. SDRs are responsible for making initial contact with target building owners and property managers and get to work with our talented team of Account Executives to convert over new customers. SDRs set the tone for the entire sales cycle and will learn how Real Estate teams make buying decisions.



The right candidate is someone who is goal oriented, thinks out of the box, has solid presentation skills, and is highly self-motivated. The right candidate also understands how to assess a company's needs and specifically cater the outreach to each prospect.


**Responsibilities**


* Identify key players, quickly assess business cases for Runwise, and formulate a pitch
* Leverage a variety of data tools to locate contact information for an account
* Utilize calls, emails, and other creative tactics to connect with accounts and drum up interest in Runwise
* Work with Account Executives to make sure deals are moving through the sales funnel and more buildings are signing on with Runwise
* Maintain clean systems and gain proficiency in CRM (Salesforce), automated email tools (Outreach), lead gen tools, city databases, and excel.


**Qualifications**



This entry-level position requires an aspiring self-starter and someone that can effectively process inquiries and identify qualified leads and opportunities. Relationship selling skills, with the ability to manage sales calls at varying levels of customer accounts, are essential.


* 0-3 years as an SDR or similar sales role.
* Real estate or EMS solutions experience is a plus.
* Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written, coupled with excellent listening skills and a positive and energetic phone presence.
* Extremely self-motivated with a diligent work ethic.
* Enthusiasm for personal career growth in a scaling company.
* High level of integrity and a energetic commitment to building a successful company.
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
* Adept computer skills including proficiency with LinkedIn, Google Suite.
* Experience with CRM applications preferred.


Salary range: $85,000- $100,000 on target earnings (65% salary and 35% commission) with uncapped commission and additional monthly sales contests.


**What you believe:**


* No job is too small.
* Sincerity builds trust.
* Setbacks fuel progress.
* Efficiency is vital.


**Benefits:**


* Medical, dental, and vision insurance
* HSA & FSA options
* Paid Parental Leave
* Access to Talkspace & Health Advocate
* Flexible PTO
* Commuter Benefits
* 401K
* Company paid life insurance
* Voluntary supplemental life insurance
* Free in-office lunch on Wednesdays
* Hybrid work environment
* Summer Fridays
* Monthly L&D Series
* Employee Resource Groups (e.g. DEIB Committee, Run Club)


Runwise is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. We celebrate and support diverse perspectives, skills, and experiences within our company.

title: Varsity Field Hockey Head Coach
description:
Trinity Hall seeks a head coach for the Varsity Field Hockey team for the current fall 2024 athletic season.  

  

Under the direction of the director of athletics, the head varsity field hockey coach oversees the skill development, planning and scheduling of the team throughout the season. Candidates must commit to proper sportsmanship and respect for players, officials, opponents, fans and other coaches. Candidates should have knowledge and experience within the sport and understand how to teach, mentor and motivate student-athletes.  

  

This is a seasonal, stipend position. The season runs now through November 15, including post-season tournaments.  

  

Responsibilities include:
* Conduct practices five days per week, generally weekdays from 3:30 - 5:30 p.m.
* Attend and coach all games, generally weekdays between 4 - 6 p.m.
* Attend special events such as the Trinity Hall Open House (10/5 and 11/6), NCAA Signing Day (if applicable) Fall Sports Awards Ceremony.


Qualifications:
* Bachelor’s degree
* Strong field hockey coaching experience with high school aged student-athletes.
* Experience working in a school setting and coaching female athletes is preferred.
* Collegiate-level playing experience in this sport is highly desirable with high school-level playing experience expected as a minimum requirement. Ability to attend all team practices, meetings, and games August through mid-November.

title: Warehouse Worker
description:
Nibav Lifts Inc. is a global leader in home elevator technology, dedicated to delivering innovative, eco-friendly, and space-saving solutions to homes around the world. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a motivated Warehouse Worker to support our logistics and supply chain operations.
  
  

**Position Overview:**  

As a Warehouse Worker at Nibav Lifts Inc., you will be responsible for ensuring the smooth and efficient flow of goods in and out of the warehouse. From receiving products to preparing shipments, you will play a crucial role in keeping our operations running smoothly. This is a great opportunity for someone who enjoys hands-on work and is looking to grow within a thriving company.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Receiving and Unloading: Unload incoming shipments, verify contents against purchase orders, and accurately record all deliveries.
* Inventory Management: Organize and store products in designated locations, ensuring items are easily accessible and properly labeled.
* Order Fulfillment: Pick, pack, and prepare customer orders for shipment, ensuring accuracy and timely delivery.
* Shipping and Handling: Prepare packages for shipment, create shipping labels, and coordinate with shipping carriers to ensure on-time delivery.
* Equipment Operation: Safely operate warehouse equipment, such as forklifts and pallet jacks, to move materials and products around the facility.
* Quality Control: Inspect products for quality and accuracy before shipment, ensuring our customers receive the best service.
* Maintain Cleanliness: Keep the warehouse clean, organized, and free of safety hazards.
* Team Collaboration: Work closely with other warehouse team members to meet daily operational goals and deadlines.


**Qualifications:**  

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Previous warehouse experience is a plus but not required.
* Ability to lift and move items up to 50 lbs.
* Good communication skills and attention to detail.
* Familiarity with basic warehouse tools and equipment (pallet jacks, forklifts) is a bonus.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
* Basic computer skills to track inventory and shipments.


Why Join Nibav Lifts Inc.?
  
* Competitive Pay: Attractive hourly rate with opportunities for overtime.
* Full Benefits Package: Health, dental, and vision insurance, along with paid time off and holidays.
* Career Growth: Opportunities for advancement within a growing company.
* Positive Work Environment: Work in a supportive and team-focused environment.
* Training and Development: We offer training and certification opportunities to help you grow in your role.

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
**About Us:**  

Sheba Foods is a vibrant and growing company, passionate about delivering the finest African cuisine to customers across the U.S. We are expanding our operations and are looking for a dedicated Warehouse Associate to join our dynamic team. If you're ready to be part of an energetic workplace with room for growth, this role is for you!
  
  

**Job Overview:**  

As a Warehouse Associate, you will play a crucial role in supporting our daily operations. Your main responsibilities will include managing the storage, organization, and movement of products in our warehouse. You will work alongside a team dedicated to efficiency, safety, and accuracy in every task, ensuring that customers receive their orders promptly and in excellent condition.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Product Handling: Receive, unpack, and store incoming products, ensuring all items are organized and placed in their designated areas.
* Order Fulfillment: Accurately pick and pack items according to customer orders, preparing them for timely shipment.
* Inventory Control: Regularly monitor stock levels, report discrepancies, and assist in maintaining accurate inventory records.
* Warehouse Organization: Keep the warehouse clean, organized, and safe by following all safety protocols and maintaining orderly workspaces.
* Equipment Use: Safely operate warehouse equipment such as pallet jacks, forklifts (if certified), and other tools as needed.
* Collaboration: Work closely with team members to ensure smooth operations and efficient workflow.


**Qualifications:**  

* Prior experience in a warehouse environment is a plus but not required. We provide training for the right candidate.
* Ability to lift and carry items up to 50 lbs.
* Strong attention to detail and ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced setting.
* Basic math skills for inventory counting and order processing.
* Good communication and teamwork skills.
* Willingness to learn and adapt to new tasks as needed.


**What We Offer:**  

* Competitive Pay: We offer a competitive hourly rate with opportunities for advancement.
* Growth Potential: We promote from within, offering you a clear path for career development.
* Flexible Scheduling: Enjoy a balanced work schedule with minimal weekend shifts.
* Team Atmosphere: Be part of a diverse and supportive team that values hard work and collaboration.
* Discounts: Take advantage of exclusive employee discounts on Sheba Foods’ delicious products.

title: Data Analyst Intern / Co-Op Student-Transportation (Spring 2025)
description:
Data Analyst Intern / Co-Op Student-Transportation (Spring 2025) - ( 240003BZ )


**Description**


We create the connections that get people and goods moving—whether by car, bus, train, bicycle, plane, or their own two feet. We provide policy, planning, and engineering services that fit the needs of our clients and improve the overall transportation experience. Join our team and help us keep communities connected.


**Your Opportunity**


We leverage data analytics to create the connections that get people and goods moving—whether by car, bus, train, plane, or their own two feet. Our data-driven approach to planning and engineering services meets the needs of our clients and enhances the overall transportation experience. Join our team and help us keep communities connected. With a unique multidisciplinary team approach, we utilize state-of-the-art survey tools, simulation models, specialized design software, computer-aided design, and advanced data analytics. Our services include traffic pattern analysis, forecasting modeling, and real-time/historic data monitoring, enabling us to optimize transportation systems and make informed decisions. The ongoing success of our team allows you to set the pace of your career.


This is a paid internship/co-op position with full time hours either Spring or Summer 2025 semester. We believe training, collaboration, and connections are strengthened by working alongside team members. Therefore, this is primarily an office position with limited remote work (if any) anticipated.


**Your Key Responsibilities**


* Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to support engineering/planning decisions.
* Create and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize data insights.
* Assist in the development and implementation of data collection systems and strategies.
* Collaborate with different project teams to understand their data needs and provide relevant insights.
* Conduct basic statistical analysis to identify trends and patterns.
* Support senior analysts in more complex data projects.
* Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing regular data quality checks.

**Qualifications**


**Your Capabilities and Credentials**


* Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and software such as Excel, SQL, and Python/R.
* Basic understanding of data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude.

**Preferred Qualifications**


* Internship or project experience in data analysis.
* Familiarity with machine learning concepts and tools.
* Knowledge of database management systems.

**Education and Experience**


* Bachelor’s degree in data science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Preference towards applicants who have completed or are currently pursuing a Master’s degree.

*This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities, and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time.*

title: Accelerate Revenue Management Intern
description:
Here at Avis Budget Group we're more than just rentals—although over 70 years of experience and 11,000 locations in 180 countries has taught us a thing or two about that. We’re shaping the future of the mobility industry with our innovative, customer-focused solutions. Our globally recognized brands - Avis, Budget, Budget Truck and Zipcar - connect people to more. This means more convenience, more options and more time on the road for our customers. But we also connect our employees to more: opportunities, benefits, support, collaboration and most importantly—power to change the future. Sound your speed? Come join our family.


**Want to accelerate your career? Join a team of driven people, performing with purpose.**

At Avis Budget Group, we are proud to be a performance driven organization. Our 21,000+ employees encourage each other to be at their best through outstanding leadership, training and tools and rewards. As a participant of our ABG Accelerate internship program you will be encouraged to explore different areas of our business to grow both personally and professionally to jump start a rewarding career.


**The 10 Week Accelerate Internship Program consists of:**

* Learning the ins and outs of your department
* Professional development workshops
* Hear from our leaders to learn more about our business
* Network with our senior leadership team
* Visit our field operations to learn how your team influences our daily operations

**What you’ll do:**

* Conduct regular market research
* Produce and distribute analysis on a daily basis
* Survey competitor rates to better position our brands in the marketplace

**What we’re looking for:**

* Ability to work 35 hours a week
* The ability to reliably commute to our Parsippany, NJ corporate headquarters at least 3 days a week
* Active enrollment at college/university

**Skills you should bring to the table:**

* Excellent analytical ability and great attention to detail
* An enthusiastic team player who thrives in a collaborative environment
* Communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing
* Strong interpersonal, organization, and time management skills
* Ability to multi-task and work independently in a fast paced environment and act with a sense of urgency
* Contribute positively to the organization, both individually and as part of a team
* Proficient MS Excel and intermediate Word and PowerPoint skills

**The fine print:**

Avis Budget Group is an equal opportunity employer – M/F/Veterans/Disabled. This advertisement does not constitute a promise or guarantee of employment. This advertisement describes the general nature and level of this position only. Essential functions and responsibilities may change as business needs require. This position may be with any affiliate of Avis Budget Group.


Avis Budget Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.


Parsippany
New Jersey

title: Department Manager-General Merchandise
description:
**Position Overview**



Manages the General Merchandise department at a large store, including managing employee activities to meet the financial and marketing objectives of the company. Coordinates sales promotions with the Home Office and manages execution in the store. This position also assists customers and suggests the selection of products based on knowledge of current products, familiarity with offerings, and customer interactions. Demonstrates strong knowledge of Follett systems and strategies (Included Program, Academic Tools, System Integrations, etc.), the industry, and the competitive landscape to execute initiatives, drive profitable sales, and control expenses. Effectively executes company programs and initiatives. Ensures compliance with company policies and procedures. Partners with various support partners, including Store Operations, RCMS, AP, HR, and Training. Consistently demonstrates Follett Values - Integrity, Accountability, Customers, Each and Every Associate, Innovation, and Teamwork. Demonstrates proficiency in Follett Strategic Competencies.


**Responsibilities**


* Supervises the employees of the department, including assigning and evaluating work as well as interviewing, hiring, and training new employees.
* Supervises the Home Office-regulated Return-to-Vendor (RTV) receiving and scanning processes.
* Assists customers in finding products.
* Manages the special order functions and notifies customers.
* Partners to create and maintain a Hassle Free customer service culture, focused on solutions-based selling and an exceptional customer experience.
* Builds key partnerships with other store staff and campus organizations for promotional and special events and assists with off-site sales opportunities (e.g., graduation, basketball, football, author signings, etc.).
* Conducts store walkthroughs daily to ensure proper stock levels, inventory placement, and customer service levels.
* Manages the in-store merchandise display from the stockroom to the sales floor, serving as the liaison between the Store and the Planner.
* Creates and maintains displays in compliance with company standards.
* Executes Home Office-initiated markups and markdowns, analyzes financial reports, processes purchase orders, and approves invoices.
* Partners with the Store Manager to execute promotions and sales and ensures proper inventory levels based on sales and trends.
* May perform website maintenance and fill orders. Maintains price accuracy and merchandise availability on the store website.
* Responds to student, faculty, staff, alumni, and other customer questions and issues resolving escalated issues as necessary.
* May manage the store in the store manager's absence or occasionally supervise other departments.
* May open or close the store.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

To learn more about Follett's benefits, click here.

New York City Applicants: $19.75-$27.54/hr



State of California Applicants: $19.75-$27.54/hr



State of Colorado Applicants: $16.75-$23.36/hr



State of Montana Applicants: $16.75-$23.36/hr



State of Rhode Island Applicants: $16.75-$23.36/hr



State of Washington Applicants: $17.75-$24.75/hr


  

* 3-5 years of relevant experience.
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent.
* 3-5 years of retail supervisory experience; computer literacy.
* Strong communication skills (verbal and written) are required.
* Previous supervisory/management experience is required.
* General computer skills.

title: Accelerate Procurement Intern
description:
Here at Avis Budget Group we're more than just rentals—although over 70 years of experience and 11,000 locations in 180 countries has taught us a thing or two about that. We’re shaping the future of the mobility industry with our innovative, customer-focused solutions. Our globally recognized brands - Avis, Budget, Budget Truck and Zipcar - connect people to more. This means more convenience, more options and more time on the road for our customers. But we also connect our employees to more: opportunities, benefits, support, collaboration and most importantly—power to change the future. Sound your speed? Come join our family.


**Want to accelerate your career? Join a team of driven people, performing with purpose.**

At Avis Budget Group, we are proud to be a performance driven organization. Our 21,000+ employees encourage each other to be at their best through outstanding leadership, training and tools and rewards.


As a participant of our ABG Accelerate internship program you will be encouraged to explore different areas of our business to grow both personally and professionally to jump start a rewarding career.


**The 10 Week Accelerate Internship Program consists of:**

* Learning the ins and outs of your department
* Professional development workshops
* Hear from our leaders to learn more about our business
* Network with our senior leadership team
* Visit our field operations to learn how your team influences our daily operations

**What you’ll do:**

* Procurement Strategic Sourcing
* Procurement interns perform strategic analysis across the supply chain: suppliers, supply markets in a selected category. They will also lead market insight work, including specific “white papers” on supplier market opportunities. Interns will learn how to drive the analytics on critical projects, how to link with Finance on driving improvement in cash conversion and how to develop and execute sourcing strategies. They will lead key cash-flow improvement projects including leveraging cash-flow platforms.
* Interns will lead a sourcing project end-to-end to drive tangible benefits. The project could be in an area of your choice: operations, facilities, supply chain, and business services. This will enable you to interact with key functional business leads and experts.
* Procurement Process Improvement
* Work closely across the organization to support continuous improvement initiatives. Interns will lead a key procurement process improvement initiative, which will drive process improvement, help knowledge management across the team and help create a platform for collaboration across the global team.
* Identify key stakeholders, owners, and resources needed to implement improvement initiatives and work with these contacts to integrate the solutions and improvement ideas introduced. Daily activities include program execution, influencing, and/or support for implementation of longer term process plans.

**What we’re looking for:**

* Active enrollment at college/university.
* Ability to work 35 hours a week at our World HQ in Parsippany, NJ
* Able to prioritize in a fast paced, high pressure, constantly changing environment; Good sense of urgency and time management
* Proficient to advanced computer skills including MS Outlook, Word Excel and PowerPoint
* Detail oriented; Demonstrates thoroughness and strong ownership of work
* Good team player with a strong willingness to participate and help others, but also the ability to work independently
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

title: Dog Walker
description:
**New York City Dog Walkers LLC**

**Great Monday through Friday opportunity for a college student going to school in Manhattan who would like to earn some extra spending money or someone with a flexible schedule. Need to be comfortable and experienced walking a very sweet big dog who is strong and reactive with other dogs. If you have the time, hours will increase over time.**

We have been in business since 2001 and are one of the best loved and most experienced dog walking services in New York City.

We care for and walk our clients’ dogs in Manhattan, NY.

Over the past 23 years we have earned the reputation as the finest, most reliable, and most trusted dog walking service in NYC.

We attribute our success largely to the outstanding people on our team working as dog walkers.

The job requires you be physically fit, be happy to walk several hours a day, be very comfortable and proficient caring for and walking dogs, and have extensive experience with dogs.

You need to be able to make a minimum 5-to-6-month commitment to work with us.

**Please include a cover letter and resume with your application. Please include a description of your experience working with and caring for dogs.**

Thank you.

New York City Dog Walkers, LLC

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $19.50 - $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 11 per week

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* No nights
* No weekends

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

* Dog Ownership: 2 years (Required)
* Professional dog walking: 1 year (Preferred)

Language:

* English (Required)

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Dental Assistant
description:
**Job Summary:**

Effective managing the day-to-day operations in the Dental Department ensuring that all patients have active Dental Health Coverage before the Dental visit. Ensuring that schedules, dental forms, approval from managed care or insurance company are in order before the Dental visit. The unit clerk should act as “support help” in such a manner as to allow the Dental providers to spend as much of their time as possible to treat patients.

**Primary Responsibility of the Position:**

* Greet, welcome, and care for all patients and visitors in a polite and courteous manner. Inform patient's arrival, create charts. Review mandatory paperwork for patient visits daily.
* Take, and develop radiographs and maintenance of same.
* Clean up and maintenance of dental equipment daily maintaining all the logs.
* Sterilization of instruments-Biological Monitoring System, DUWL shocking and testing.
* Seats and prepares patients for examination of dental treatment. Set up the room for procedures.
* Assists the Dental Provider chairside as needed.
* Answering the telephone and appropriately book and following up as needed for coordination of dental treatment including patients with predetermination approvals.
* Ordering of supplies and maintaining a proper inventory.
* Always be aware of confidentiality. – HIPPA Regulations
* Report all issues of importance to the Dental Director. Help explain Dental Department Policy to patients.
* Update patient information (phone number) to provide courtesy calls and appointment reminders to patients.
* Keep daily sheets with names and status of the day's patient appointments, cancellations, no show.
* Be aware of all Dental Policies to ensure compliance.
* Verification of insurance eligibility and benefits.
* Other duties as assigned by the Dental Director.

**Education and Experience:**

* High School Diploma required.
* Registered or Licensed Dental Assistant.
* HIPPA, Infection Control, CPR.
* Ability to relate well to staff members.
* Knowledge of Word, Excel.

EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* No weekends

Experience:

* Dental assisting: 1 year (Required)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* X-Ray Certification (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* White Plains, NY 10607 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Lead Estimator
description:
* New Rochelle, NY - Onsite
* Fulltime Perm
* $150,000 - $220,000

  

  

  

**DESCRIPTION:**  

  

As a **Lead Estimator** you will be reporting to **VP Estimating**, you will have the opportunity to:  

* Conduct a thorough review of the contract plans, specifications and other documents for the bid items assigned.
* Know general requirements and special conditions.
* Be aware of the proposal requirements and discuss with VP Est / Chief Est.
* Identify major and unusual items.
* Solicit quotations from major subcontractors and suppliers.
* Prepare HCSS comparison sheets.
* Identify D/M/WBE requirements, prepare GFE using SmartBid.
* Develop clear write-ups and documentation required for SOQ / RFP type proposals.
* Prepare documents for bid and proposal submission.
* For Joint Venture bids, set up JV manual.
* Prepare pre-bid or green sheet estimate.
* Set up Bid in HCSS.
* Price-up bid items and review with VP Est / Chief Est.
* Timeline equipment.
* Provide assignments and monitor take-off estimators.
* Build job and determine means and methods.
* Maintain dialogue with owner’s representative.
* Know insurance and bonding requirements, complete financial worksheet.
* Review risks and selected subcontractors / suppliers with VP Est / Chief Est.
* Close out bid with Chief Estimator and submit bid.
* Prepare procurement strategy along with subcontracts and purchase orders.

**REQUIREMENTS:**  

* BS in Engineering from an accredited institution and 10+ years experience in heavy civil construction working with a general contractor
* Included within the 10 years above, shall be min 5 years in estimating
* Experience working on projects in the NYC area valued at 100+ million preferred
* Fluent with the following software:
	+ HCSS Heavy Bid
	+ Blue Beam
	+ Excel
	+ Primavera P6
	+ SmartBid
* Excellent written and verbal skill

title: Dental Assistant
description:
### **Join the future of dentistry, led by dentists**


*At Dental365, we're reshaping the way patients experience dental care. By placing patients and providers at the core of our approach, we're breaking new ground in the world of dentistry. Since our inception in 2014, we've touched the lives of hundreds of thousands of patients and have emerged as a leading and distinguished dental organization, led by dentists. If you're a motivated change-maker looking to build a lifelong career in dentistry – now is the time to take part in our journey.*


**At Dental365, dental assisting is about crafting confident smiles, building your skills, and delivering compassionate care for our patients.**


### **OUR PRACTICE:**


**Dental Care Princeton**  

301 N Harrison Street, Princeton, NJ 08540


### **HIRING SCHEDULE:**


* Sunday: OFF
* Monday: OFF
* Tuesday: 9:00am - 7:00pm
* Wednesday: 9:00am - 8:00pm / 12:00pm - 8:00pm (alternates)
* Thursday: 9:00am - 7:00pm
* Friday: OFF / 8:00am - 5:00pm (alternates)
* Saturday: 8:00am - 3:00pm / OFF (alternates)

### **RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Welcoming patients with a smile, making them feel comfortable and confident throughout their visit.
* Support the Dentist with various procedures.
* Ensure strict infection control by meticulously preparing and sterilizing instruments and equipment.
* Sanitizing and prepping operatories for respective treatments.
* Adhere to OSHA and safety policies, prioritizing a secure and healthy environment.
* Educate patients on effective oral hygiene strategies as needed
* Undertake diverse office tasks as needed for seamless practice operations.

### **QUALIFICATIONS:**


* *Previous experience in Dental Assisting and NJ Radiology certification required! Open to applicants on the pathway to obtaining their certifications!*
* Any certification/license as required by the state to perform specified duties.
* A resume showcasing a consistent and stable employment history.
* Strong interpersonal communication skills, delivering exceptional patient experiences.

### **OUR BENEFITS:**


* **Generous Compensation:** We invest in the best and are competitive in our salary offers.
* **Flexible Health and Vision Insurance Plans**: Tailored options for you and your family's well-being.
* **401(K) Retirement Plan with Matching:** Secure your financial future with our employer-matched plan up to 6%.
* **Generous Paid-Time Off:** Accrue up to 3 weeks, plus an annual "you" day for self-care.
* **Exclusive In-house Dental Program**: Heavily discounted services for you and your immediate family.
* **Fresh Scrubs:** Accrue an annual scrub allowance through our uniform partners.
* **Extra Perks and Fringe Benefits:** Enjoy additional benefits and ongoing perks for our dedicated teams.


* *All benefits available at full-time employment (30+ hours weekly). Some benefits available for part-time employees as well.*


### **Step into a new era with Dental365**


**A modern practice environment designed for superior care and comfort.** We embrace cutting-edge technology in a soothing environment that goes beyond your ordinary dental practice. We've thought through every step in the patient's experience to perfect our communication and care so that each visit is an eagerly anticipated event.


**We're a team that supports your success.** Emphasizing health over sales, we cultivate a warm, supportive culture without the pressure of production quotas. Those motivated for growth in their career are encouraged and supported to reach their full potential.


**Dental365 celebrates diversity.** Our company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression in terms of all conditions of employment. Our diversity is one of our greatest strengths, and as an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to promote a work environment where all differences are respected.

title: Part-Time After School Cooking Instructor
description:
Unleash your passion for cooking and inspire the next generation with Serious Fun!

As a Cooking Instructor at Serious Fun, you will lead children in engaging, hands-on exploration of cooking through various cuisines and techniques, including international dishes and healthy meals. You will help students develop their culinary skills while teaching kitchen safety, nutrition, and teamwork. Ensuring the safety and well-being of each student in the kitchen is a top priority. Through positive teaching styles and encouragement, you will guide and empower students. You will develop quarterly lesson plans and be supported in the kitchen by a Group Teacher. The Enrichment Cooking Instructor is supervised by and reports directly to the Multi-Site Director, Programming.

**Who We Are**

Serious Fun After School is a non-profit organization that provides affordable arts enrichment and after school programming to NYC public schools in Queens, NY.

**We Create Fun – We Are Kind – We Foster Excellence – We Believe In Balance**

**What You’ll Do** 

As a Dance Instructor at Serious Fun, you will lead children in engaging, hands-on exploration of dance through various styles and techniques, including ballet, hip-hop, jazz, and contemporary. You will help students develop original choreographies while teaching confidence, rhythm, and stage presence. Ensuring the safety and well-being of each student on and off the stage is a top priority. Through positive teaching styles and encouragement, you will guide and empower students. You will develop quarterly lesson plans and be supported in the classroom by a Group Teacher. The Enrichment Dance Instructor is supervised by and reports directly to the Multi-Site Director, Programming.

**You will:** 

* Create engaging activities that foster the development of new skills in children, while building on prior knowledge.
* Ensure that classroom guidelines are fair, clear, and easy to understand.
* Design the physical layout of your class (within the space available) that best supports positive behavior.
* Confidently model positive behavioral management skills for the Group Teacher supporting you.
* Ensure the safety and security of all participants while in your classroom and during transitions.
* Assist your Serious Fun colleagues in the smooth operation of the program, lending a helping hand when needed, especially during transitions.
* Complete 15 hours of professional development each calendar year, as well as attend all meetings, training workshops, and special events (maximum four (4) per quarter) as required.
* Complete background checks, fingerprints, medical, etc. as required by the New York State Office of Children and Family Services (NYS OCFS).

**Who You Are** 

* You believe in our Vision, Mission, and Values.
* You have either:
* A Bachelor’s degree in Culinary Arts, Nutrition, or related field; or related field;

OR

* An Associate’s degree in Education, Early Childhood with certification in related field; OR
* A High School Diploma with certification in related field and demonstrated minimum of 2 year’s experience facilitating in related field.
* You feel “called” to working with children and have a passion to make a difference.
* You are a collaborator with a growth mindset.
* You are a leader who listens and is open to learning new things and solving problems in new ways.
* You love creating a dynamic environment where learning, play, and discovery meet!
* You use your whole self to engage with children and your team.
* You have strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task and manage situations effectively.
* You have strong conflict resolution skills.

**Hours:**

Monday: 2:30pm-5:30pm

Thursday: 2:30pm-5:30pm

Friday: 2:30pm-5:30pm

*With additional hours for shopping and lesson planning.*

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $50.00 - $60.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 15 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Referral program
* Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* Afternoon shift

Work Location: In person
