title: Data Analyst
description:
**Title: Data Scientist**

**The Impact You Will Have:** As a Data Analyst at Liberty Home Guard, you will be responsible for overseeing the work streams that relate to Liberty Home Guard's data-driven operations. Your role will involve using advanced analytics to optimize our service processes, including customer claims, repairs, and technician dispatching. Your focus will be on building predictive models to enhance the efficiency of our proprietary claim management system, leveraging data to reduce operational costs and improve customer satisfaction.

As a key team member at Liberty Home Guard, you will play a critical role in driving our data strategy, maximizing the efficiency of our systems, and ensuring that our technology continues to support our rapid growth and impeccable ratings across consumer platforms.

This role reports to the Executive Team and co-CEOs of Liberty Home Guard, providing you a great opportunity to work firsthand with decision makers and key stakeholders.

**Responsibilities:** 

* Develop predictive models to improve customer retention, technician dispatch efficiency, and claim processing times, using machine learning and advanced statistical methods.
* Analyze large datasets related to customer claims, technician performance, and operational workflows to identify trends and optimize service delivery.
* Analyze customer behavior and purchasing patterns to assist in developing targeted marketing campaigns and sales strategies.
* Build predictive models to forecast customer lifetime value, churn rates, and acquisition costs.
* Collaborate with the marketing and sales teams to develop A/B testing frameworks, optimize lead generation, and evaluate the effectiveness of promotional activities.
* Provide insights on customer segmentation to tailor product offerings and improve customer engagement.
* Analyze customer claim data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for process improvement in claim resolution.
* Work with technician-related data to optimize dispatch and assignment efficiency, ensuring the right technician is matched with the right job based on skills, availability, and proximity.
* Use predictive analytics to forecast claim volumes and technician capacity needs, ensuring adequate resource planning.
* Develop metrics to monitor technician performance, response times, and success rates to improve customer satisfaction and reduce claim resolution times.
* Collaborate with the claims and operations teams to automate and streamline the claims management process, improving speed and accuracy.
* Provide insights into claim denial rates and reasons, enabling the business to make data-driven adjustments to policies and procedures.
* Identify key metrics and KPIs for operational efficiency, such as service response times, technician utilization, and first-time fix rates.
* Build dashboards and reporting tools for real-time monitoring of operational performance.
* Perform root cause analysis to address any inefficiencies or bottlenecks in the operations process, driving continuous improvement.
* Develop machine learning algorithms and predictive models to support various business functions.
* Create clear data visualizations and presentations to communicate findings to stakeholders across departments.
* Ensure compliance with data privacy and security regulations.
* Work closely with the technology and operations teams to optimize the performance of our proprietary claim management system by applying data-driven insights.
* Utilize customer data to predict service needs and improve customer satisfaction by proactively identifying potential system or appliance failures.
* Build dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into key business metrics, helping Liberty Home Guard maintain its industry-leading standards.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including marketing, technology, and customer service to drive data initiatives that support Liberty Home Guard’s growth and customer satisfaction goals.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Applied Math, Statistics, or other relevant quantitative discipline, or equivalent industry experience. Master’s degree is preferred.
* 3-5 years of experience in Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field with a focus on predictive modeling, statistical analysis, and data architecture development.
* Familiar with statistical analysis, programming languages (e.g., R / Python) and querying relational databases (e.g., SQL)
* Advanced experience in pattern recognition and predictive modeling
* Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
* Experience using business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) and data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop)
* Experience with Power BI and Machine Learning.
* Experience working with and creating data architectures.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
* **Position Type: In-Person Only**

Please note that this role is exclusively an in-person position. We do not offer remote or hybrid opportunities, as our business operates fully on-site

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Tableau: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY 11223 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY 11223: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Research Fellow
description:
**Applecart** is the leading technology company creating a new category of "Decision Maker Marketing". The most important decisions are made by the hardest people to reach and influence. Historically, C-suite leaders have lacked the tools to reach the stakeholders that matter most to their business. The C-suites of hundreds of Fortune 500 companies, major agencies, trade associations, nonprofits, and governments use Applecart to put their best content in front of business critical decision makers and those they trust — from policymakers and investors to CEOs, key employees, members of the media and more. Decision makers are informed by what they read, learn from advisors, hear from colleagues, and discuss with family and friends. To break through to them, you must reach them through the only channel that really moves them: those they know and trust. Applecart's platform uses publicly available or fully permissioned data to map billions of social relationships between nearly every American adult and enable clients to deliver content directly to decision makers and those that matter most to them.



We are hiring **Research Fellows in our New York City office.**


**About the Role**



You will be responsible for supporting our Decision Maker Marketing platform. In this role, you will help in the delivery of best-in-class data and strategic tools to influential stakeholders in both the private and public sectors. You will work with our talented research team who impact outcomes and marketing for Applecart's high profile clients. **This is an hourly (30+ hours per week with the possibility of overtime), 6-month contract position with the potential to extend or convert to a full-time permanent position.**


**What You'll Do**


* Assist staff with research tasks
* Data entry and information management
* Identify publicly available data sources
* Contribute to internal development projects to improve team processes


**Experiences and Capabilities You Bring:**


* Ability to work well with a team in a fast-paced, self-motivated environment
* Particularly sharp attention to detail
* Exceptionally strong written and verbal communication skills
* Strong interest in current events (including political and business affairs)
* Comfort and confidence in problem-solving as a team and autonomously
* Impeccable attention to detail and superior organizational skills


**This is a hybrid role. Work from anywhere on Monday and Friday and in Applecart's New York City office Tuesday through Thursday.**


**Compensation:**



The hourly rate for this role is $25/hr. The pay rate provided for this role is specific to candidates located in the New York City area.


**A few facts about us:**


* Applecart's platform has been used by hundreds of industry-leading clients spanning Fortune 500 companies like Blackstone and Intuit, leading nonprofit organizations like the Environmental Defense Fund, and top-tier communications and public affairs firms like Teneo, Sard Verbinnen, and Weber Shandwick.
* Applecart is growing quickly — 2023 was the fourth year in a row that we doubled the previous year's bookings.
* Our senior leadership team includes two members of the Forbes 30 under 30 list for Marketing and Advertising, the former Head of Product at Moat, Oracle's online ad measurement platform, a former senior White House advisor, an early sales leader at Google and Twitter, two of the Democratic Party's most successful pollsters and strategists, and alums of top-tier organizations like Bain, Amazon and Simpson Thacher.
* Our investors include global sports, entertainment and marketing giant Endeavor, KKR Co-Founder Henry Kravis, entrepreneur Chris Burch, a founder of Palantir, senior engineering leaders at Twitter and Yelp, former Fortune 50 and advertising agency CEOs, and a number of well-known venture capitalists. Endeavor CEO Ari Emanuel and Owl Capital Managing Partner Jennifer Fonstad serve on our board.
* Our work has been featured on Morning Joe on MSNBC, BloombergTV and The Colbert Report, and in Axios, BusinessWeek, the Associated Press, Forbes, the Washington Post, and Politico, among many others.

title: Patient Care Associate- Hamptons - Nursing Students Welcome!
description:
As a **Patient Care Associate at our Hamptons/Water Mill location**at Sollis Health in our Hamptons location you will assist in providing direct care to our patients under the supervision of a Physician as well as request clerical tasks. You will assist in coordinating care to meet patient needs which may include obtaining vital signs, medical history, simple wound dressings, updating medical records, preparing, and running lab tests and front desk coverage.


**Part Time - 9am-5pm Off Season and 7am-7pm In Season - 24 Hours/Week**



Responsibilities:


* Perform vital signs, height, weight, and screening procedures and document findings in the medical record.
* Establish good interpersonal relationships with members
* Communicates pertinent patient observations to members of the health care team.
* Run lab tests ordered by the medical team or established standing protocols including specimen collection, proper identification on specimen, label the specimen with all required information and handle the specimen according to Sollis Health guidelines.
* Process patient specimens, run them according to manufacturer's instructions and according to laboratory protocol.
* Provide exceptional customer service. Make patients comfortable and patiently and professionally answer any questions they have.
* Enter information into our electronic health record, Athenahealth
* Functions as an emergency as a team member with guidance from supervisory personnel.
* Perform phlebotomy procedures.
* Uses proper body mechanics, help with lifting, moving or transferring patients as needed.
* Perform clerical and administrative duties, as needed, including but not limited to, answering phones, patient check-in and documentation.
* Perform related duties as requested


**Experience** We believe extraordinary people come from a variety of backgrounds, but ideally, we would expect that you have:


* High School Diploma or equivalent required.
* Successful completion of a NYS Certified Nursing Attendant program, Medical Assistant program or other state-licensed program such as EMT, required OR completion of two years of clinical course work actively pursuing RN, ACP or MD degree
* 1-3 years of relevant experience preferred.


**Skills:** To be successful in this role, candidates will demonstrate the following:


* Enjoy a diverse and fast-paced work environment
* Be a team player
* Have excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Tech-forward and process-oriented, with a goal of making patient care more efficient
* Ability to juggle multiple priorities at once
* Treat highly confidential information with care and discretion
* Develop rapport in all relationships
* Be flexible, tactful, and patient, especially under pressure
* Possess positivity, enthusiasm, and commitment to the goals at hand

  


**Compensation**



Range: $20-$30/hour



This is the range of pay for New York candidates only. Sollis is a multi-state employer and this rate/range may not reflect the pay for positions that are performed solely in localities outside of New York. Furthermore, actual pay is dependent on several factors that may include but are not limited to years of experience within the job, years of experience within the required industry, location, education, etc.

  


**About Sollis Health**



Sollis Health is a 24/7 members-only medical concierge service delivering expert, on-demand, emergency medicine treatment in a serene and private environment. Designed to handle emergencies, everyday care, and everything in between, we provide expert care in our state-of-the-art centers, virtually via a telehealth visit, and in the comfort of our member's homes. The Sollis experience also includes our house call program, patient coordination and advocacy provided by our care navigation team and more. We service New York, the Hamptons, Los Angeles, South Florida, and San Francisco and provide around-the-clock telemedicine worldwide.



Sollis Health is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Consistent with our policies, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected group status protected by law, including, but not limited to, race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.
company_description: Sollis Health is a healthcare services business currently revolutionizing emergency medicine and urgent care. Sollis is a members-only 24/7 medical concierge service.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
**About Fly E-Bike:**  
Fly E-Bike is a rapidly growing e-bike company focused on revolutionizing personal transportation. We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Marketing Manager to drive our marketing efforts both online and offline, ensuring our brand reaches and engages with our target audiences effectively.

**Job Summary:**  
The Marketing Manager will be responsible for developing, implementing, and executing strategic marketing plans to grow the Fly E-Bike brand. This role covers both digital and traditional marketing efforts, including but not limited to social media, retail marketing, Google Ads, and events. The ideal candidate will be creative, data-driven, and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Develop and Execute Marketing Strategies:** Create and lead marketing initiatives to increase brand awareness and drive sales both online and in retail locations.
* **Online Marketing:**
* Manage and optimize social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, etc.) to engage with our community and increase brand visibility.
* Create and manage Google Ads campaigns to drive traffic and sales.
* Oversee content creation, email marketing, and SEO strategies to enhance online presence.
* **Offline Marketing:**
* Collaborate with retail partners to implement in-store promotions and marketing strategies to drive foot traffic and sales.
* Plan and execute local and regional events, pop-ups, and collaborations to enhance brand engagement.
* **Analytics and Reporting:**
* Track, measure, and report on the performance of marketing campaigns across channels, making data-driven adjustments as needed.
* Use analytics to optimize Google Ads and social media marketing efforts.
* **Brand Management:**
* Ensure consistent brand messaging and visual identity across all marketing channels and touchpoints.
* Work closely with design and product teams to create marketing materials aligned with Fly E-Bike’s brand and goals.
* **Collaboration:**
* Work cross-functionally with sales, operations, and product teams to align marketing strategies with business objectives.
* Manage relationships with external vendors, agencies, and partners as needed.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in marketing, with proven experience in both online and offline marketing.
* Strong knowledge of social media platforms, Google Ads, and retail marketing.
* Data-driven with the ability to analyze metrics and adjust strategies accordingly.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* Creative thinker with a passion for driving brand growth and engagement.

**Preferred:**

* Experience in the e-bike or transportation industry.
* Familiarity with marketing automation tools and CRM systems.

**What We Offer:**

* Competitive salary and benefits.
* A collaborative and innovative work environment.
* Opportunities for growth and development in a fast-growing industry.

title: Sommelier
description:
**Who are we?** 

We as Nusr-Et, are a culinary empire that crafted the art of dining with its unique blend of exquisite flavors and theatrical presentation. Renowned for its mastery of fine cuts, Nusr-Et has captivated the taste buds of discerning diners worldwide.

Nusr-Et boasts an extensive international presence, with 32 restaurants strategically located in prominent cities across the globe, including New York, London, Dubai, Istanbul, and Miami. The culinary prowess of Nusr-Et is underscored by making each dining experience a celebration of taste and texture.

Nusr-Et reflects a commitment and dedication to excellence. But this is what meets the eye. Do you want to know what goes on behind the scenes in creating such unforgettable culinary journeys? If your answer is yes, then get ready to get a taste of the fine dining world at Nusr-Et.

Nusr-Et Steakhouse is looking to bring on a dynamic and experienced Sommelier to join our award-winning hospitality team. Sommelier is responsible for supporting the seamless running of the wine department, providing a highly efficient and effective service, educating, and recommending customers on wine choices and pairing, and ensuring standards are maintained and customer needs are anticipated.

**What do we look for?**

* Sommelier: 5 years (Required)
* Upscale Fine Dining Service: 2 years (Required)

· High School Diploma

· Good communication and organizational skills.

· Ability to handle stressful situations and be able to prevent and/or handle emergency situations.

· A cheerful, positive attitude when working with a variety of people, and be able to work well under pressure.

· Responsible, neat and clean in appearance.

· Strong communication skills with supervisors and team members.

· Must be able to read, write and speak English.

**What will you work on?**

* Recommends wines to patrons based on price, personal taste, and food selection.
* Oversees the serving and storage of wine and trains team members on the wine selection.
* Ensure wines are served in the correct glassware and at the proper temperature.
* Demonstrates a friendly personality, strong knowledge of wine and spirits, and great interpersonal skills.

· Possesses an expert understanding of regional wine laws, appellations, grape varieties, harvest times, elevation, climate, soil, and fermentation processes.

* Ensures that all customers receive the best possible service and care.
* Is confident in making recommendations and wine pairing.
* Maximizes sales opportunities through upselling and profitability through attentive service.
* Works with restaurant staff to create a positive dining experience for guests.
* Greets customers and answers all questions.
* Alerts team members when tables need attention if they are not present and assists them in helping with their tables.
* Has knowledge of the menu, with the ability to make suggestions.
* Ensures tables are enjoying their meals and takes action to correct any problems.
* Has a thorough knowledge of the wine menu.
* Is a professional, valued member of the team with a flexible approach to improving customer experience.
* Arrives at work for a scheduled shift and is punctual, always following company absence and lateness procedures if unable to do so.
* Ensures that all wine stock levels are maintained, and correct ordering procedures are carried out.
* Ensures the wine storage is always kept clean and tidy.
* Monitors standards and supply of all appropriate equipment, ensuring the management team are aware of any needs.
* Ensure all wine lists are current and up to date.
* Responsible for completing and maintaining weekly wine inventory
* Treats company property with due care and attention.
* Attends meetings / training sessions as required by the management team.
* Is fully aware of current legislation regarding hygiene, licensing laws, weights, and measures as they apply to the restaurant.
* Adheres to and maintains cleaning checklists.
* Can remain focused and on-task.

**What’s in store for you?** 

· Daily breakfast and lunch provided

· Health Insurance, Vision Insurance, and Dental Insurance offered

· Nonexempt PTO – 40 hours accrued (based by state)

· Sick pay (based by state)

· Flexible schedule

· Employee of the month nominations

title: Care Manager l 5 Boroughs of NYC
company: The Collaborative for Children and Families
description:
**About the Collaborative for Children and Families (CCF)**

The Collaborative for Children and Families, Inc. (CCF) is a 501c3 Non-Profit Membership Coalition comprised of over 20 Community Based Organizations (CBOs) whose primary mission is to serve children and families across the downstate region of NY. CCF is designated as a Lead Health Home Serving Children (HHSC) that includes a provider network of over 40 Care Management Agencies (CMAs). CCF offers comprehensive health and human services to children and families in a more coordinated manner than could be achieved individually and seeks partnerships with other components of the health and human services systems to integrate care for those in greatest need.

**Position Summary:**

The Care Manager (CM) works under the direct supervision of the Care Manager Supervisor and plays a critical role in achieving the overall goals for coordination, integration, and partnership in the delivery of care to children, youth, and families with complex medical, developmental and behavioral health needs between the ages of Zero (0) to Twenty-One (21). The Care Manager develops and implements a patient-centered, comprehensive Plan of Care (POC) for the member, in partnership with his/her caregivers and providers. The Care Manager is the central point of contact for the family and the child/youth, to ensure that their needs and services are met, their voices are heard, and their needs and preferences are integrated into their plans of care. The care manager must ensure that all minimum required face-to-face contacts occur timely based on the client’s complexity level, which is determined by the Child Adolescent Needs and Strengths-New York (CANS-NY) assessment. Core Services include:

* Comprehensive Care Management
* Care Coordination & Health Promotion, including linkages to needed services to support care plan/treatment goals, coordination and advocacy with service providers and health plans, and interdisciplinary team case reviews.
* Transitional Care, including planning and follow-up for admission to, and discharge from hospital and other inpatient settings.
* Patient & Family Support, including partnership and consultation with each child’s family/caregivers on the child’s care plan.
* Referral to Community & Social Support Services

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Obtain required Care Management enrollment consents from the medical consenter and all documentation to support clinical eligibility criteria from providers.
* Assess the appropriateness criteria of other household members that may be eligible for Care Management services and make referrals as appropriate.
* Complete an initial needs assessment including the Child Adolescent Needs and Strengths-New York (CANS-NY).
* Responsible for the overall management of the client’s Individualized Plan of Care (POC) to ensure the following: Coordination of services, Support adherence to treatment recommendations, and monitor and evaluate the client’s needs, including prevention, wellness, medical, behavioral health treatment, care transition, and social and community services when appropriate.
* Complete all program/case relevant documentation in the Electronic Medical Record (EMR) within the assigned timeframes.
* Based on the complexity outcome of the client, the care manager must meet the specified minimum face-to-face requirements for billing as per the Department of Health’s (DOH) mandates.
* Conduct all other required additional assessments within prescribed time frames including a Comprehensive Assessment, Crisis Plan, and Home and Community Based Services (HCBS) Level of Care (LOC) eligibility. determination for the provision of services when appropriate.
* Function as an advocate for the client.
* Communicate with the client’s Medicaid Managed Care Plan (MMCP) to ensure there are no gaps in care.
* Promote wellness and prevention by linking members with resources and services based on their individual needs and preferences.
* Effectively communicate and share information with the client and their family/caregivers with appropriate consideration for language, literacy, and cultural preferences.
* Facilitate and lead Interdisciplinary Team Meetings to effectively coordinate services.
* Identify any available community-based resources and actively manage appropriate referrals, access, engagement, follow-up, and coordination of services. This may include scheduling appointments, transportation, and providing interpreter services when needed; as well as accompanying clients to appointments and following-up with their caregiver to ensure appointments are kept.
* In the event of hospital admissions, actively engage in the discharge planning process to ensure that the client has recommended post discharge services in place prior to scheduled discharge.
* Attend and participate in ongoing staff development training to enhance skills needed to effectively meet the demands of the Care Manager position.
* Develop close working relationships with other care team members including child welfare case planners when applicable and/or case managers in other service systems and/or settings.
* Perform all other duties as assigned.

**Requirements:** 

* A Bachelor’s degree (Masters preferred) with two years of experience working with children, youth and adolescents.
* Have a working knowledge of the health & behavioral health care industry in New York.
* Maintains a strength-based approach in working with children, youth, and their families.
* Ability to work directly with a diverse population consisting of individuals who are diagnosed with chronic life-threatening Chronic conditions including behavioral health conditions and substance use challenges.
* Computer literacy, specifically Microsoft Word, Outlook, and Excel.
* Excellent telephonic and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work directly with a multidisciplinary care team of professionals and paraprofessionals.
* Applicants must demonstrate trustworthiness as a prerequisite for independent work within this role.This position requires in -person visits. Candidates will need to be able to travel to do these visits via car or public transportation. Caseload to be located in or near identified counties- but is not limited to counties listed.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.

**Working Conditions**

* Must be willing to maintain case load sizes from 25-40 cases monthly.
* Work is conducted in the home and communities of the clients.
* Travel within the five Boroughs is required based on caseload.

It is the policy of the CCF that the company wholly complies with the equal treatment of all employees and applicants for employment, without unlawful discrimination as to race, creed, color, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status or veteran status in all employment decisions, including, but not limited to recruitment, hiring, compensation, training and apprenticeship, promotion, upgrading, demotion, downgrading, transfer, layoff, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Evenings as needed
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* Are you willing to travel within the borough of NYC depending on your caseload?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Care Management: 1 year (Required)
* care plan: 1 year (Preferred)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

title: Project Manager (DAS Specialist)
description:
**COMPANY OVERVIEW**

Since 2002, Mason Technologies has been a leader in technology integration, proudly certified as a Woman-owned Business Enterprise (WBE) both in NYC and nationally. With headquarters and a fully equipped warehouse in Deer Park, NY, an additional office in downtown NYC, and resources across the nation, we design, implement, and service innovative solutions in low-voltage structured cabling, audio visual systems, data centers, and unified security.

We serve a variety of industries including healthcare, government, higher education, finance, and business (both big and small). We're always aiming to build lasting relationships based on trust, respect, and a shared vision for a better future. Our founder, Jennifer Mason, has cultivated a family-like environment that emphasizes deep care and commitment to our people and the clients and communities we serve, forming the foundation of everything we do.

At Mason Technologies, diversity and inclusion drive our hiring, ensuring we bring together the most talented individuals regardless of race, age, religion, gender identification, or sexual orientation. If you want to have a career of unparalleled growth, a team with a family-strong bond, and an unmatched atmosphere of motivated and caring professionals, apply to Mason today!

Let’s craft a future together that's built upon integrity, equality, professional pride, the authentic spirit of our family, and a commitment to making the world a better place.

**Our Comprehensive Employee Benefit and Perk Package**:

· **Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage:** Comprehensive healthcare benefits to keep you and your family healthy and secure.

· **401k with Matching:** Plan for your future with our 401k program, featuring competitive company matching.

· **Paid Time Off (Holiday/Vacation/Sick/Personal):** Generous PTO to ensure a healthy work-life balance and time for relaxation and personal needs.

· **Unlimited Growth Opportunities:** We believe in fostering talent and providing opportunities for continuous professional growth.

· **Family-Friendly Company Events & Outings:** We host regular events and outings to foster a family-friendly atmosphere and build team camaraderie, like our Warehouse Jam Sessions and Holiday Parties!

· **Bagel Thursdays & Friday Lunch Catering:** Enjoy weekly treats with Bagel Thursdays and Friday Lunch catering at our offices!

· **Caring Ownership:** We believe in mutual dedication. If you're committed to Mason Technologies, we are equally committed to you. We prioritize the well-being of our employees and their families, ensuring a supportive and caring work environment.

**Job Description**

Summary - You will be responsible for reviewing project drawings/scopes of work, establishing a schedule and deployment plan for each assigned project. This will include interfacing with the customer and other trades, as well as the internal routing, procurement, programming, and rack fabrication teams. You will be managing your own team; Mason does not subcontract so all resources are internal.

* High level knowledge of DAS Systems
* Testing coaxial cables, fiber optic cables, and other RF components.
* Programming and commissioning DAS equipment, ensuring proper functionality and coverage. JMA FIPLEX
* Conducting signal testing using spectrum analyzers, signal generators, and other RF test equipment.
* Performing site surveys to determine optimal antenna placement and coverage areas.
* Optimizing system performance by adjusting power levels, antenna orientations, and other parameters.
* Diagnosing and troubleshooting issues with RF DAS systems, including signal interference, RF noise, and equipment failures.
* Minimum of 5 years of Project Management experience
* Ability to direct projects by collaborating with Mason resources and external consultants, architects, end users, etc.
* Capable of managing multiple high-level projects at one time
* Able to work closely with Account Management team to strategize on customer engagement
* Experience managing multiple crews operating concurrently on multiple job sites
* Projects will be a combination of new construction and retrofits
* Ability to interface with the customer and provide schedules as well as updates on project status
* Building weekly reports to illustrate project completion status
* Working closely with finance to review milestones and completion percentages to provide necessary documentation for billing
* Experience engaging with various project stakeholders both internal and external
* Manage project flow throughout the entire process. This begins with the procurement of materials and establishment of schedule and follows through to the coordination of deliveries, staffing, and installation.
* Ability to review construction plans, rack elevations and bills of materials to establish labor estimates, material requirements and schedule.
* Interface directly with the customer to review accuracy of scope and maintain schedule
* Manage client expectations from delivery windows to complete system operation
* Ensure system functionality is complete and gain customer sign off at the conclusion of each project

Position requires travel to and between job sites in Long Island, NYC, and New Jersey.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Opportunities for advancement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

title: Assistant Director of Nursing - PACU
description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals

NYC Health + Hospitals/Bellevue is America’s oldest public hospital, established in 1736. Affiliated with the NYU School of Medicine, the 844-bed hospital is a major referral center for highly complex cases, with its 6,000 employees including highly skilled, interdisciplinary clinical staff. It sees more than 110,000 emergency room visits and 500,000 outpatient visits annually. Bellevue is an academic medical institution of international renown. We have served as an incubator for major innovations in public health, medical science, and medical education. Bellevue is a Level I Trauma Center delivering around-the-clock care in adult, pediatric, psychiatric and pediatric psychiatric emergencies as well as in the nationally-designated categories of cardiology, neurology, toxicology, and neonatology. In addition to providing comprehensive inpatient and outpatient state-of-the-art care Bellevue is a city-wide medical specialty referral source. Bellevue’s clinical centers of excellence include: Emergency Medicine and Trauma Care; Cardiovascular Services; Designated Regional Perinatal Center and Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (ICU); Comprehensive Children’s Psychiatric Emergency Program; and Cancer Services.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

Job Description

**Purpose of Position:** 

Under the guidance and direction of the Director of Nursing, the A.D.N is responsible for planning, organizing, directing, coordinating and evaluating the quality of care rendered in the E.D. The A.D.N has the authority and responsibility of managing the unit in order to guarantee the quality of care for every patient assigned to the unit and is held accountable by the use of the nursing process. She/he is responsible for the implementation of the Nursing Department's philosophy and objective of nursing care into management of nursing care on the patient's unit.

**Job Responsibilities:**

- Receives report by making walking rounds with incoming/outgoing staff.

- Coordinates patient care by collaborating with the multidisciplinary team.

- Assess each patient needs and establishes appropriate plan of care based on Nursing Assessment and diagnosis.

- Maintains standards of care by ensuring that an individualized plan of care for each patient is developed and implemented.

- Evaluates nursing care, the patient's response to intervention and make modifications as needed.

- Delegates assignments based on staff competence and priority of patient care utilizing the departmental triage classification system.

- Supervises and assists the staff in patient assessments, documentation, implementation and evaluation of nursing care.

- Supervision of professional and non-professional personnel.

- Completes performance evaluation for assigned staff.

- Maintains attendance profiles on personnel, which will be reviewed periodically.

- Other tasks as assigned by Supervisor or designee.

Minimum Qualifications

. Licensed and currently registered to practice as a professional nurse in New York State, plus (2) or (3), below.

2. Masters Degree in Nursing Administration, Education, Clinical Specialty or equivalent field and five years of satisfactory nursing experience, of which three years shall have been in a supervisory or teaching capacity; or a Baccalaureate Degree in Nursing and six years of satisfactory nursing experience, four years of which shall have been in a supervisory or teaching capacity.

3. A satisfactory equivalent of education and experience. However, all candidates must be licensed and currently registered to practice as a Professional Nurse in New York State.

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $116,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Supervising experience: 6 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* RN (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Lead Estimator
description:
**Job Title: Lead Estimator**

**Salary Range: $165,000.00 - $175,000.00**

**Job Type: Full-time (no remote or hybrid)**

**JOB DESCRIPTION:**

PJS Group is a collection of corporations delivering quality construction and design build services including general construction (Paul J. Scariano, Inc.), heavy civil utility and subsurface construction (DeBoe Construction Corp.), electrical services (PJS Electric, Inc.), and various project specific joint ventures. PJS Group shares a common set of values and ethics that encourages participation from every stakeholder involved with a project. We specialize in projects that are time sensitive, have complex design elements and challenging constructability requirements. We are an experienced union contractor with a highly qualified, creative, and motivated team of managers, engineers, and tradespersons who are ready to exceed our customers every expectation.

To learn more about us, please visit www.ipjs.com.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

· Preparing and leading the estimating process for heavy civil construction projects.

· Reading and reviewing all bid documentation to ensure a complete understanding of the project.

· Preparing and overseeing detailed take offs and estimates thoroughly and in a timely manner.

· Understanding and adhering to project goals and deadlines.

· Proposing innovative solutions.

· Managing, leading and coaching Estimating staff to ensure efficiency and a high level of performance.

· Soliciting, evaluating, and negotiating sub-contractor quotes.

**KEY REQUIREMENTS:**

· Bachelor’s or master’s degree, preferably in Civil Engineering.

· Vast knowledge of heavy civil construction projects with a mix of experience with bridges, roadways, paving (concrete and asphalt), earthworks and utilities (water, sewer, drainage) required.

· Minimum of 15 years of civil construction estimating and field experience, preferably on public works projects in New York.

· Prior experience managing staff with the ability to lead, coach, and guide.

· Ability to work well under pressure and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

· Strong communication, organizational, and problem-solving skills with excellent detail orientation and a keen sense of urgency.

· Ability to build positive and sustainable relationships with peers, subordinates, and vendors.

title: Global Influencer Director, Skin Health & Beauty
description:
Description  


Kenvue is currently recruiting for:  



Global Influencer Director – Skin Health & Beauty  



This position reports to Senior Director, Glboal Neutrogena Megabrand and is based in Skillman, NJ  


**Who we are**

At Kenvue, we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we’re the house of iconic brands - including Neutrogena, Aveeno, Tylenol, Listerine, Johnson’s and BAND-AID® Brand Adhesive Bandages that you already know and love. Science is our passion; care is our talent. Our global team is made up of ~ 22,000 diverse and brilliant people, passionate about insights, innovation and committed to delivering the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means having the power to impact the life of millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage – and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future–and yours.  


**Role reports to:** **Senior Director, Glboal Neutrogena Megabrand****Location:** Kenvue’s corporate headquarters is currently located in Skillman NJ, but is scheduled to move to Summit, NJ in or around early 2025.
**Travel %:** 25%
**Pay:** $144,000- $247,250  


**What you will do**

The Global Influencer Director – Skin Health & Beauty will be responsible for making influencer marketing a competitive edge for NEUTROGENA globally, esp. aiming at top-3 Influencer Reach (paid+earned) in our priority markets, and achieving competitive skinfluencer mindshare.  



The Director will lead a team of influencer leaders and will drive directly the influencer strategy and deployment for Neutrogena, the largest brand of Kenvue’s portfolio and one of the largest skin care mega-brand of the globe.

The role will be based in the US and report to the Senior Director, Global Neutrogena Megabrand.  



Responsibilities:

1. **Lead the Global Influencer Playbook and Content Calendar** (incl. R&Rs) with the goal of sharpening Neutrogena’s brand edge: Derm. Science, Made Simple, with a Beauty Experience
* Develop a competitive global annual content calendar, including content toolkits, seedings and tentpole events to fuel our competitive share of advocacy


* Coordinate the execution of the influencer marketing campaigns by the priority countries to drive brand awareness, engagement, and sales.


* Be a key member of the Global Brand team and collaborate with cross-functional teams – including Marketing, HCP, R&D, Science Engagement, Commercial and CBI – to build our influencer efforts at the heart of all our brand building activities and overall business objectives. Build strong synergy and partnership with the Global Neutrogena Derm.


* Lead our R&R playbook and coordinate its global execution to reach top-5 share of R&Rs in our priority countries

  



2. **Lead the build-up of a competitive Global Neutrogena influencer Community**, focused on skin influencers and long-term partnership
* Strategize and implement creative influencer partnerships tools to support the priority countries in building a balanced, proactive and engaged community of influencers, ensuring alignment with brand values and target audiences


* Support priority countries in identifying and collaborating with top skin influencers, with strongest impact and affinity with the brand edge (Dermatological Beauty)


* Lead partnership and negotiate contracts/agreements with global high-profile influencers (ex: #DermDoctor) to ensure clear expectations and deliverables are established, and to maximize our global impact and reach.


* Act as a liaison between the brand and our top influencers, facilitating communication and ensuring a positive experience for all parties involved, especially in tentpole events

  



3. **Lead the Tracking of our Influencer Marketing performance** to drive action and competitiveness
* Monitor and analyze influencer performance metrics in close collaboration with Tracker, providing regular reports and insights to optimize future collaborations, and drive the action of our priority countries. Our target is to achieve top-5 in Reach and VIT Score in our priority markets


* Keep track of best influencer, user-generated and R&Rs content to leverage it for branded omni-channel activations across multiple platforms, and to fuel our advanced consumer understanding and insight in close collaboration with CBI


* Stay abreast of industry trends and competitor activities, in partnership with Tracker and our key agency partners, to identify new opportunities and build a competitive edge.

  



4. **Build and lead a High-Performance team of Influencer Leads** who will make Influencer marketing a competitive edge for our Kenvue Skin Health & Beauty Business
* The Director will lead a team of 3 Influencer experts



o Global Influencer Lead – Aveeno

o Global Influencer Lead – Dr. Cilabo

o Global Influencer Lead – OGX
* The Director and their team will be responsible for forming a powerful community of practice across the Skin Health & Beauty organization (Global Brand teams, Countries, Tracker, Agencies, HCP leads, etc..) and accelerate our influencer marketing capabilities


* The Director will play a key Thought Leadership role to continuously sharpen our influencer model (Process/People/Tools) to leapfrog and keep our brands on the edge of influencer competitiveness
  


  

Qualifications **What we are looking for**  



Required Qualifications  


* Bachelor's degree is required. In marketing, communications, or a related field.


* A minimum of 10 years of proven experience in influencer marketing, specifically in the skincare industry.


* Strong understanding of skincare trends, ingredients, and consumer preferences.


* Excellent communication and negotiation skills.


* Strong People leadership, with a passion for attracting and growing talents


* Ability to analyze data and interpret influencer performance metrics.


* Creative thinking and the ability to develop innovative influencer marketing strategies.


* Familiarity with social media platforms and their respective algorithms.


* Results-driven mindset with a focus on achieving key performance indicators (KPIs).


* Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.


* Passion for skincare and beauty is a requirement.

  


**What’s in it for you**
* Annual base salary for new hires in this position ranges from **$144,000-247,250****.**This takes into account a number of factors including work location, the candidate’s skills, experience, education level & other job-related factors.


* Competitive Total Rewards Package\\*


* Paid Company Holidays, Paid Vacation, Volunteer Time & More!


* Learning & Development Opportunities


* Employee Resource Groups


* This list could vary based on location/region

  


* Note: Total Rewards at Kenvue include salary, bonus (if applicable) and benefits. Your Talent Access Partner will be able to share more about our total rewards offerings and the specific salary range for the relevant location(s) during the recruitment & hiring process.

  



Kenvue is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Actuary
description:
**About Quartet Health**



Quartet is a purpose driven value-based behavioral healthcare company, building the nation's leading behavioral health home. We deliver integrated care and better outcomes to improve the health of communities across America. Quartet is a trusted partner of health insurance plans, health systems, community behavioral health centers, certified community behavioral health clinics, and federally qualified health centers in 36 states across the country. We identify people in need of care and connect them directly to high quality behavioral care providers, including Quartet's own medical group.



At Quartet, our values guide the way that we work together, starting with our commitment to putting patients first, and our shared focus on collaboration and innovation, so that we – together – can improve lives, one person at a time.



Quartet is backed by top investors like Oak HC/FT, GV (formerly Google Ventures), F-Prime Capital Partners, Polaris Partners, Deerfield Management, Centene Corporation, Independence Health Group, and Echo Health Ventures.


**About the Role**



We are seeking a skilled Senior Actuarial Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience in actuarial analysis, particularly within the healthcare or insurance industry, and exposure to Medicare Advantage is a plus.


**Role Responsibilities**


* Conduct actuarial analysis to support various business functions.
* Data Analysis: Perform data analysis to support actuarial assumptions and decision-making processes.
* Assist in the preparation and analysis of financial reports.
* Forecasting and Budgeting: Support financial forecasting and budgeting efforts.
* Work with cross-functional teams to support business objectives.
* Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and guidelines.
* Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement best practices in actuarial methodologies.
* In your first 90 days: Begin to conduct basic actuarial analyses and data analyses, gaining a foundational understanding of key business functions and financial reporting requirements while starting to support team efforts.
* Within your first 6 months: Start to contribute to financial forecasting and budgeting processes with guidance, work effectively with cross-functional teams on assigned tasks, and ensure adherence to basic regulatory requirements while learning about actuarial methodologies.
* Future success: Develop a solid grasp of actuarial processes, gradually identify and suggest improvements, and contribute to supporting business objectives and regulatory compliance as you build expertise and take on more complex responsibilities.


**Required Qualifications**


* A bachelor's degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
* A minimum of 3 years of actuarial experience, preferably in the healthcare or insurance industry.
* You are pursuing Associate of the Society of Actuaries (ASA) designation..
* You have experience with financial forecasting and budgeting.


**Preferred Qualifications**


**You have a proficient level of programming skills, such as in SQL or R**


* Expert user of Excel
* Proficiency in python programming
* Consulting and/or Client management experience


**Our Benefits**



We're proud to offer the following benefits to our team members:


* Fully remote work environment
* A flexible PTO policy and paid holidays
* Paid parental leave
* Robust medical, dental and vision insurance plans
* A 401(k) plan with employer match
* Mental health benefits
* 100% employer-paid life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance
* Annual learning & development budget


**Compensation:**


* A reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this role is **$108,000 to $132,000,** with an additional annual bonus target percentage.
* The final compensation for this role is based on several factors including, but not limited to, type of position, location, education level, work experience, and certifications.


Quartet actively encourages applicants of all backgrounds to apply and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform essential job duties - reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions. If you require assistance in completing this application, interviewing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to talentops@quartethealth.com


***Have someone to refer?*** *Email* *talentops@quartethealth.com* *to submit their details to us.*

title: Union Maintenance Technician - The Westmont
description:
At Equity Residential, we're dedicated to creating thriving communities, and we invite you to be part of our team. Embracing values like Diversity, Sustainability, and Total Wellbeing, we foster a workplace culture of authenticity and collaboration.


**How We Deliver A Winning Performance:**

* Question Authority
* Walk the Talk
* Share Knowledge
* Listen, Not Just Hear
* See the Glass Half Full
* Take Educated Risks
* Enjoy the Ride
* Share the Spotlight
* Do the Right Thing
* Test Your Limits

**We Care About Your Total Wellbeing:**

* Physical Wellbeing: Medical, dental, and vision care
* Social Wellbeing: 9 paid holidays, annual vacation time, paid sick leave, new parent benefits
* Financial Wellbeing: 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan, Rent Discounts, Competitive Compensation
* Community Wellbeing: Paid Community Service Hours
* Career Wellbeing: Leadership Development
* Learn more about our Total Wellbeing program here.

**What You’ll Be Doing:**

As a Maintenance Technician, your day-to-day will involve addressing resident service requests, performing diverse hands-on maintenance tasks, and ensuring market-ready apartments. Additionally, you will perform preventative maintenance and maintain the grounds and common areas, reporting any concerns.


* Promptly addressing resident service requests
* Performing hands-on maintenance tasks, including plumbing, electrical work, and more
* Preparing market-ready apartments and maintaining community grounds
* Conducting regular community inspections to identify necessary repairs or replacements

**What You’ll Need To Thrive:**

* Hands-on maintenance experience in areas including, but not limited to plumbing, electrical, appliance, and HVAC is necessary.
* High School diploma or equivalent
* Valid driver’s license and good driving record along with auto insurance will be required when working between multiple sites that require driving throughout the day. If you do not possess a valid driver’s license, you will be required to sign an addendum agreeing not to drive any form of registered motorized vehicle while at work/on the clock.
* Computer literacy, and must be able to effectively communicate both orally and in writing in English for all work-related purposes
* Knowledge of federal and state apartment housing laws
* Availability to work a flexible schedule, including weekends
* Must be able to respond to emergencies after normal business hours and on weekends when assigned on-call responsibilities; a telephone number where you can be reached after-hours must be provided to your manager
Service team employees, with limited exceptions, are required to use their own smartphone to perform certain aspects of their job  
* 

  

**Salary** : $30.6758/hr


**Bonus Qualifications:**

* Trade school certification/diploma
* EPA Section 608 Type I, Type II or Universal certification
* Residential or commercial property management, hospitality, or retail experience

  
ABOUT US  

Working for Equity Residential (EQR), a leading multi-family real estate investment trust (REIT), means living our purpose: creating communities where people thrive. It means striving to provide the best in apartment living, speaking boldly about new ideas for innovation, and inspiring creativity in the ways we work together.  

  

Our portfolio of high-quality properties in urban growth markets – New York City, Boston, Washington DC, Seattle, San Francisco, Southern California, and Denver – provides homes where people most want to live, work and play. We've got the best people in the business, as evidenced by our employee engagement scores and customer loyalty ratings. That’s why our employees say they are proud to work at Equity, a company that gives our residents a place where they can Live Remarkably, and offers a culture where our employees have the opportunity to thrive.  

  

  

**Equity Rewards**When you join Equity Residential, you won’t be treated as simply another employee — you will be considered a partner in our shared success. As such, we are committed to investing in your personal success through a benefits program that supports your Total Wellbeing.


We recognize that everyone has different needs outside of work. That’s why, in addition to a competitive benefits package (medical, dental, vision and paid time off), we offer many unique benefits options to employees, like a comprehensive wellness program, pet insurance, new parent benefits, and paid time off for community service projects. In addition to your next job, you can also find your next home with us! Rent discounts on Equity Residential apartment homes are available to our benefits-eligible employees. The amount of the discount offered is determined based on the market, ranging upwards from 20%.  



  

  

**Equity Values**At Equity Residential, like our residents, our employees come from everywhere. A richly diverse work environment captures top talent, cultivates the best ideas, and creates the widest possible platform for success. By focusing on inclusion, these differences are harnessed to create value — in ideas, business practices, relationships, and employee engagement. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to maintaining a diverse, inclusive and equitable work environment where our employees can thrive.


All aspects of the employment process are merit-based. Every Equity employee is expected to maintain a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment. Equity Residential does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant because of race, religion, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, sexual/gender identity/expression, age, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation or related medical conditions), physical or mental disability, national origin, citizenship status, military (including uniformed service member or protected veteran) status, marital status, genetic characteristic or information, ancestry or any other characteristic protected by law. Equity Residential also prohibits retaliation against individuals who report harassment or discrimination, or participate in investigations into such conduct.

title: Manager, Secure Services
description:
Own is the leading data platform trusted by thousands of organizations to protect and activate SaaS data to transform their businesses. Own empowers customers to ensure the availability, security and compliance of mission-critical data, while unlocking new ways to gain deeper insights faster. By partnering with some of the world's largest SaaS ecosystems such as Salesforce, ServiceNow and Microsoft Dynamics, Own enables customers around the world to truly own the data that powers their business.



It's their platform. It's your data. Own it.

**The Job**
-----------



To meet the growing demand of our organization, we are seeking a passionate, intellectually curious, and collaborative **Secure Services Manager** who has a desire to join our dynamic and high-performing Secure Services team. As a leader, you will play a critical role in helping to build a successful team of experts to better drive value for, educate, and consult with our Secure customers on the details of security and governance within their Salesforce ecosystem.


**Your Day-to-Day Role**
------------------------


* Manage a team of security experts to deliver recurring and one time services to a portfolio of Secure customers
* Work directly with key customers to facilitate services and oversee delivery for Ownbackup Secure Services within the Salesforce ecosystem
* Serve as the primary point of escalation for the New Jersey team
* Lead team strategies and manage resources to improve efficiencies and support the success of our customers
* Lead onboarding programs and training for new team members
* Lead cross team enablement and training on Secure Services and workshops
* Apply leadership experience to provide coaching, mentorship and support to your team and customers
* Maintain up-to-date awareness of privacy policy impacts on both our customers and the engagements we perform
* Design new customer experiences and implement new assets to expand our Secure Services offerings

**Your Work Experience**
------------------------


* 5+ years of management or equivalent experience
* 5+ years in technology consulting, project management, or sales engineering for cybersecurity products and/or services
* 5+ years experience working with Salesforce or other CRM Platforms (Salesforce certified preferrable)
* Strong experience speaking with and presenting to groups of people at all levels within an organization
* Familiarity with legal and regulatory compliance standards (e.g. PCI-DSS, HIPAA, GLBA, FINRA, GDPR, CCPA, SOX, etc.) as well as SaaS Security Frameworks
* Excellent written and oral communication
* Team player, with a strong work ethic and attention to detail

**Important Details**
---------------------



This is a full-time position. The ideal candidate will work out of our Englewood Cliffs, NJ office a minimum of 3 days per week to maximize collaboration and interaction with the business. Travel may be required.



Own is dedicated to creating an environment where employees thrive, which is why base pay is only one part of the total compensation package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work. This role may also be eligible for unlimited PTO, generous medical benefits, a 401(k) savings plan with a 4% employer match, discretionary bonuses/incentives, and stock options. We also offer catered lunches in the office five days a week, a full fitness center, and free shuttle bus service to and from New York City.



Creating an environment where employees thrive also means making sure every employee feels accepted. As we scale to help all types of companies protect precious data, our team must reflect the diversity we serve. Own is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we believe that every employee in the company brings a unique perspective that they can and should contribute in order to make an impact every day. We strive to be one team and one culture that builds trust through transparency. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, protected veteran status or disability status.



Learn more at owndata.com.

title: Associate Buyer, Sandro-Paris - New York, NY
description:
SMCP - Sandro, Maje, Claudie Pierlot

### **Associate Buyer, Sandro**


### **44 Wall Street 20****th** **Floor, New York, NY 10005**


### **NYC Pay Transparency Pay Range**


* $75,000-$85,000

### **Who We Are**



At SMCP, we are proud to be a global leader in the luxury fashion industry, renowned for our Parisian Chic ready-to-wear and accessories. From Shanghai to New York City, our international presence is driven by our commitment to sustainable growth and innovation. With four distinctive brands – Sandro, Maje, Claudie Pierlot, and Fursac – we operate in 46 countries, spanning a wide range of retail environments from stand-alone boutiques to shop-in-shops and outlets. Our U.S. and Canada eCommerce platforms further expand our reach, reinforcing our role as trailblazers in the world of contemporary luxury fashion.



Explore our global presence and discover more about our journey at https://www.smcp.com/en .


### **What Sets Us Apart as an Employer in the Global Luxury Fashion Space**



At SMCP, we are more than just a luxury fashion company – we are a community that prioritizes purpose, sustainability, and innovation. Our Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) strategy, built on the pillars of Product, People, and Planet, reflects our dedication to making a positive impact. We embrace diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB) as core values, shaping a workplace where every team member's voice is heard and respected.With over 6,500 passionate entrepreneurs across the globe, we cultivate a collaborative environment where creativity thrives. Our commitment to CSR, paired with our sought-after Parisian chic collections, makes SMCP a place where you can grow your career while contributing to the future of fashion. Here, your passion fuels our purpose as we shape the future of global luxury.


### **What We Are Looking For**



We are currently seeking an entrepreneurial, solution-minded Associate Buyer to support our Sandro Buying Department. The major function is to own our Sandro Men's business, to build brand desirability and drive sales in the North America Business Unit. This position will be an integral part of the department and must be able to build strong relationships with cross-functional, global and partner teams to support key merchandising strategies. This role will report directly to the Senior Merchandising Manager.



Job responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:


**SEASONAL PLANNING & BUYING**


* Build seasonal & core assortment through category & SKU plans, aligned with OTB & capacity targets
* Participate in 4 buying sessions in Paris; buy collection, input orders, and review feedback with Central team
* Determine product needs for each region, channel and wholesale partner for assortment localization
* Manage in-season replenishment and stock adjustment based on business need
* Manage promotion & markdown Entries in accordance with Commercial Calendar


**REPORTING & ANALYSIS**


* Analyze sales on a weekly basis to provide in depth review of product performance and develop action plans by category & channel
* Prepare detailed Monthly & Seasonal Business Reviews along with Assortment Investment review to draw actionable strategies and impact upcoming collection development with Central Merchandising teams
* Partner with Planning team to align on sizing and door group strategies by category and channel based on performance
* Conduct frequent store visits to analyze market trends, gather collection feedback, hindsight on product and build in-store relationships


**CROSS-FUNCTIONAL & EXTERNAL TEAM COLLABORATION**

* Create North America Men's Merchandising Strategy in close collaboration with Senior Merchandising Manager
* Communicate on key business drivers and opportunities with Paris counterparts to champion market needs & exclusives
* Partner with cross-functional teams (PR, Marketing, VM, Ecomm) on key 360 communication initiatives, product exposures and collection launches
* Work closely with Planning/Allocation department on product allocation, stock balance, replenishment and reorders
* Collaborate with Partners team and Retail to support expansion of business by providing line sheets and product knowledge documents based on winning assortment strategy
* Support external partners with detailed business review and identify action plans for untapped opportunities


**MARKET AWARENESS & SPECIAL PROJECTS**


* Remain informed of fashion/trends and apply knowledge to assortment and promotional plans
* Demonstrate and communicate awareness of retail landscape; Conduct research on competitive set including pricing, assortment and trends to be able to identify opportunities, category trends to drive business
* Assist in coordination of product training for store employees to maximize awareness of the season's collection and trends


**QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS**


* College degree; Merchandising degree, a plus
* French speaking is a plus
* 2-3 years of related experience in Merchandising/Buying/Retail
* Strong computer skills (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint) & ability to learn new systems
* To be a positive, flexible, team player; to work independently as needed and to have strong self-initiative, resourcefulness, prioritization and time management skills
* Excellent verbal & written communication and follow-through skills
* Highly organized and detail-oriented with the ability to handle multiple projects with adherence to deadlines
* Must be able to work independently as well as on group projects
* Position based in our NYC office; Hybrid remote work schedule; US work visa required.
* Ability to travel both domestically and internationally, about 30% of the time

  


**WHAT WE WILL OFFER YOU IN RETURN!**


* Fun/collaborative, team-oriented work environment
* Travel/ Expense reimbursement
* Health, Vision, and Dental Insurance
* Generous shopping discount
* Generous PTO Bank
* 13 corporate holidays with early dismissals the day before the holiday.
* 401K Savings Plan
* Clothing Allowance
* Lucrative Base + Annual Bonus structure
* Culture of Engagement
* Career Growth Opportunities
* Flexible hybrid work schedule
* 4 completely remote workweeks per year.

title: Inside Sales Representative
description:
Shore Funding is a rapidly growing financial marketplace that provides capital solutions to small businesses across the United States. As a member of the Inc 5000, we are seeking an Inside Sales Representative to join our team and assist with the growth of our sales floor and the entire company. The position offers a starting salary of $600 per week, plus commission, with a minimum earning potential of $100k in the first year and up to $250k in the second year. All leads will be warm, and there will be no cold calling or weekend work. This is a full-time position, and remote work is not available. However, we offer an aggressive commission structure, high renewal commissions, and extensive hands-on training, along with opportunities for growth and promotion within the company. If you are a high-energy, entrepreneurial, and collaborative individual seeking a dynamic work environment, this may be the opportunity for you to earn $150,000.00 or more per year.

----------------------------

Shore Funding is a rapidly growing financial marketplace that provides short, medium, and long-term capital solutions for small businesses across the country. We have recently been recognized as one of the fastest-growing companies in America in 2022 by Inc 5000. Our team is seeking an Inside Sales Representative to join us in driving sales floor growth and contributing to the overall expansion of the company.

The position offers a starting salary of $600 per week, along with additional commissions. The earning potential for the first year is a minimum of $100k, and it can increase to $100k-$250k in the second year. This role involves working with warm leads; no cold calling is required, and there is no weekend work. Remote work is not available, and the candidate must commute to the office.

We offer an aggressive commission structure, high renewal commissions for residual income, a competitive base salary, and opportunities for substantial growth. The selected candidate will receive extensive hands-on training, and promotion from within the company is encouraged. Our work environment is high-energy, entrepreneurial, and collaborative. This is a full-time position with an earning potential of $150,000.00 +++ /year.

*\\*Remote work not available. Must commute to the office.\\**

· *Extensive hands-on training*

· *Promote from within*

· *High Energy, entrepreneurial, and collaborative work environment*

We offer a very aggressive commission structure along with the ability for our inside sales reps to build a book of business and earn residual income month over month through high renewal commissions.

Average inside sales reps will have the ability to make $100,000+ in their first year.

title: Upper School Study Hall Monitor
description:
Berkeley Carroll is a Pre-K through grade 12 college preparatory school of close to 1000 students located in the Park Slope section of New York City. Our vibrant intellectual community draws students from all over the city, admission to the school is competitive, and both our parents and students value achievement and community.


**Berkeley Carroll’s Upper School seeks a full-time (8:30AM-3:30PM, Monday-Thursday; 8:30-2:45, Friday) Study Hall and student space monitor starting Oct. 1, 2024.**


We are seeking an employee to staff the Upper School Study Hall (or similar student space) each day. While this employee will need to remain in the same space for all or most of the school day, there is also some opportunity for individual work (reading, writing, etc) each period. This primarily student-facing role involves the following responsibilities:


* Taking attendance each period.
* Ensuring students are following the rules and norms of the space (regarding technology use, silent study, etc).
* Coordinating make-up testing by distributing and managing exams and ensuring compliance with exam expectations.
* Maintaining an environment that ensures academic integrity
* Communicating proactively with students, faculty, and the Upper School Office, both in person and via email.


Requirements:


* Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree
* An interest in being part of a school community
* Strong interpersonal skills
* Comfort setting and maintaining boundaries with high school students.


Berkeley Carroll is committed to creating an environment that includes a diversity of perspectives and to cultivating an equitable, inclusive learning community in which everyone has the opportunity to experience a sense of belonging. Candidates with a demonstrated commitment to and experience with diversity, equity or inclusion work are especially encouraged to apply.


The salary range for this position is $30.00 - $35.00 an hour.


Candidates should send a cover letter, resume, and completed **Berkeley Carroll Employment Application** to:


Tell Blackstock, Upper School Office Manager: sblackstock@berkeleycarroll.org


Sarah Sterling, Upper School Administrative Assistant: ssterling@berkeleycarroll.org

* Shifts Available Friday: 9 am - 7 pm
* Shifts Available Saturday: 9 am - 5 pm

Residential Valet/Package Room Attendant

The Valet is responsible for attending to residents and engaging with them to ensure they have a top-notch experience while living in their building, neighborhood and city. The valet/package room is a crucial point of contact for residents to receive their packages and is responsible for building strong relationships with them and other staff members.

Mission - Your mission is to provide outstanding client service to residents and work with staff to enhance their experience through direct communication and hospitality. You will act as the liaison between residents, staff, and building management at different levels. As the package management valet, you will an important point of contact for our residents.

What You Will Do:

* Greet all residents by name upon their arrival, delivering high-quality customer service
* Manage the packages coming into the building and inform residents when packages have arrived using building software.
* Communicate your responses/resolution to building management and to your manager as needed

You’re Good At:

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* High level data and computer skills
* Great customer service orientation
* Strong critical thinking and creative problem solving skills
* Ability to connect at all levels with staff and residents, engaging with different stakeholders

You Need:

* **BuildingLink, Yardi, or ActiveBuilding Experience**
* Excellent time management and team working skills
* Ability to lift and carry 40 pounds for short distances
* Additional language skills are a plus
* Applicants selected for these positions are required to undergo a background check and drug screening

Note: We comply with all mandates regarding COVID-19. An offer of employment is contingent on candidate meeting vaccination requirements against COVID-19 in accordance with current New York City regulations as the health and wellbeing of our employees is a priority. We continue to focus on providing a safe workplace for our people and are committed to contributing to the safety of our communities.
